item.title: Farewell to 'London's first paparazzo': Ray Bellisario, dead at 81, achieved candid royal photos other photographers could only dream of (even if Prince Philip did want to send him to the Tower)
item.description: The son of Italian immigrants, Ray Bellisario was born in Pontefract and snapped his first photo of the Queen at 18. When a newspaper paid him for it, his career as 'London's first paparazzo' took off.
item.content:encoded:
Photojournalist Ray Bellisario, who has died at the age of 81, was so tenacious in his quest for the best photograph - whether his subject was the Queen of England or Jackie Kennedy - that he earned the moniker 'London's first paparazzo.'

Indeed, the royal family came to loathe Bellisario, the son of Italian immigrants who was born in Pontefract, because his lens was constantly by their side on family holidays during the Fifties, Sixties and early Seventies.

Princess Margaret was so irritated by his candid shots of her enjoying waterskiing in her swimsuit that she used to call him 'That bloody Bellisario!' 

Scroll down for video

The Yorkshire photojournalist was a thorn in the monarchy’s side, shooting the Queen relaxing on family picnics, Prince Charles driving through London in a sports car and Princess Anne as a young bathing belle.

It was the year after the young Queen was crowned, 1954, that the 18-year-old novice photographer, whose family ran a business selling ice cream, took a picture of her sheltering under an umbrella that was published by several newspapers.

Bellisario realised he was on to something and decided to concentrate his efforts on the Royal Family, but seek something different from the rest of the press pack.

He said later, 'It was a business decision, nothing more, nothing less. I used a mixture of common sense and contacts. Of course I got tip-offs, but I also thought about things very laterally.'

Bellisario used to infuriate Prince Philip, who frequently remonstrated with the photographer in the coarsest of terms, also ensuring that he was blacklisted by most British newspapers (although his pictures were published abroad).

 In 2013, Bellisario put up his entire 23,000-strong catalogue and its copyright up for auction in aid of charity.

Some of his photographs, such as the one of Prince Charles sitting on a chair while waterskiing on the lake at Sunninghill Park, Windsor, show a fun side to the Royals, rarely seen in public.

Bellisario had been standing on a footpath by the lake when he was approached by Princess Margaret’s then husband, Lord Snowdon, who told him: ‘If you hang on we’ll do something that will really make your pictures. Keep an eye out for the chair!’

Bemused, he waited and soon Prince Charles came whizzing past, sitting on an old chair, which had been balanced on an upturned table, with grinning Snowdon at the wheel of the speedboat.

Other images, however, capture some truly historic moments — such as the Queen meeting with her supposedly estranged uncle, the Duke of Windsor, who had come to London in 1965 for eye surgery.

The 'grey suits' at Buckingham Palace, as courtiers are often known, publicly and emphatically denied that she had any plans to meet her uncle, given the family’s continuing bitterness over his 1936 abdication.

The father-of-three eventually gave up on the royals in the mid Seventies and a more serious news tone was added to his work, with conflicts in Northern Ireland, Nigeria and the Western Sahara becoming his subjects instead. 

By 1990, a spinal condition saw him confined to a wheelchair and he used his voice to campaign for better disability rights.
item.dc:abstract: The son of Italian immigrants, Ray Bellisario was born in Pontefract, West Yorkshire and snapped his first photo of the Queen at just 18. When a newspaper paid him for it, his career as 'London's first paparazzo' quickly took off and for almost 30 years he captured shots of the royals at leisure. much to their annoyance, with Princess Margaret labelling him 'That bloody Bellisario!' (Pictured clockwise from top left: Princess Margaret waterskiing in 1967, The Queen at Badminton Horse Trials in 1968, Princess Anne in her swimsuit in 1969 and Prince Charles taking a car for a spin in London in 1971)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Tweedy
item.mi:shortTitle: Obituary: 'London's first paparazzo' Ray Bellisario dies at 81

item.title: The home improvements that will net you the biggest profits when selling your property - and why a new kitchen and an attic conversion could LOSE you money
item.description: GoCompare has teamed up with property expert Henry Pryor to identify the upgrades that are really worth your money, including installing a new boiler which adds £8K value at a cost of £2k..
item.content:encoded:
When you're considering making renovations to your home, often the thought of adding value to the property when it comes to selling can be a deciding factor. 

However, experts have revealed that while most improvements will increase the potential asking price, the added value is not always greater than what you spend in the first place. 

GoCompare has teamed up with property expert Henry Pryor who is a regular fixture on BBC Breakfast and Radio 4's Today programme, to identify the upgrades that are really worth your money. 

His findings reveal that the most profitable home improvement is installing a new boiler for a cost of £2,000 which will add £8,000 in value, making you a profit of £6,000. 

Increasing home security and energy saving measures are also worth your while, but updating bathrooms and kitchens and putting in new flooring won't add more value than what you've spent, leaving you at a loss. 

'It's therefore that you think carefully why you are spending extra money and who will benefit,' he said.

'My advice is usually 'spend money on the things that you want and leave other improvements to the next person who may not share your taste. 

'Most people who are thinking of selling their home or looking to improve it to add value will consider the merits of a trip to the DIY store, some will even consider doing some building work in the hope of adding value but not all buyers will be prepared to pay for your idea of improvements or good taste.

'Some buyers would even prefer to be able to put their own mark on a property and install the bathroom or kitchen of their choosing and may even pay for the chance to be able to do so. 

'Most buyers prefer to pay for the opportunity to be able to add an attic conversion, kitchen extension or convert a basement. 

'Getting planning permission to do the work is frequently the best investment you can make leaving the actual choice of layout, decoration and equipment to the next owner. 

'Improving the green credentials of a house usually pays - a new boiler, insulation or energy saving measure along with security improvements will usually pay off but some additions like solar panels will be hard to get a payback on immediately.'

If you can't afford to do any major work before trying to sell your house, the good news is that one of the biggest improvements you can make costs very little. 

'My advice to most people is that the best investment they can make is to buy a bucket, sponge and some cleaning materials,' Henry explained. 

'There is always value in giving the right first impressions and letting buyers go away discussing the potential of the property rather than the rim around the bath can add pounds to your price. 

'Unless you really know the market and what people really want then you are better off making clear the potential in your property and letting their imagination do the rest. 

'A clean, tidy property will always command more than a scruffy home that looks like a skip.'

item.mi:shortTitle: Home improvements that will net you the biggest profits

item.title: Double trouble! 'Peru Two' drugs mule Michaella McCollum takes her twins out for a stroll four weeks after welcoming her 'little darlings'
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The former 'Peru Two' drugs mule, 24, was seen taking her new arrivals - whose names she has not yet revealed - for a walk in a park near her home in Belfast on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
She announced she had become a mother for the first time after welcoming twins just four weeks ago.

And Michella McCollum has been spotted taking her 'little darlings' out for a stroll in Belfast.

The 'Peru Two' drugs mule, 24, was seen taking the new arrivals - who MailOnline can now reveal are both boys - for a walk in a park near her home in the Northern Irish capital on Tuesday.

The former jailbird looked every inch the doting mother as she pushed the newborns around in a double pushchair before pausing for a cuddle on a park bench.

Proudly displaying her post-baby body in a floral miniskirt from River Island teamed with a cosy red knit and flyknit trainers, Michaella couldn't wipe the smile from her face as she cosied up to her little bundles.

She teamed her pared-back look with oversized shades and a pair of diamond stud earrings. 

The new mother announced the news of their birth on Instagram last month by sharing a sweet clip with her newborns, captioned: 'My little darlings, 1 week today.'

And she certainly hasn't held back when it comes to chronicling the realities of motherhood, writing on a recent post: 'Not often these days when I'm not covered in pee and spew.'

She also revealed her joy at being able to fit into her pre-pregnancy clothes, but has so far declined to share who their father is - prompting speculation that she is embarking on this next chapter alone.

MailOnline has contacted a representative for Michaella for comment.

Michaella, who shot to notoriety in 2013 when she and her friend Melissa Reid were arrested in Lima for smuggling drugs and dubbed the Peru Two in the press, revealed just this week that her newborns are boys.

She has also never revealed who the father of the twins is, but has posted snaps on Instagram with a mystery man - thought to be her boyfriend - omitting his face from the pictures. 

And she gave followers no hint during her pregnancy that two babies were on the way, displaying only a tiny bump in her recent social media posts. 

A snap from the end of April showed her with a neat baby bump, but she hinted that birth was imminent, saying: 'I guess I am gonna have to shop infant car seats soon.'   

Reid and McCollum met in Ibiza in 2013 where they were employed by a drug-dealing gang.

They were sentenced to spend six years and eight months inside a grim jail in Lima, after they were caught at the airport trying to smuggle £1.5M worth of cocaine.

However, they were released after serving three years with Michaella returning to Northern Ireland in June 2016.  

Since her release from prison, Michaella has become something of a public figure, attending events and escaping the chilly British weather on a string of sun-kissed holidays last summer.

Her bikini-clad snaps on various sunny getaways have become something of a regular fixture in the media.

Following her release, Michaella was spotted living it up in party centres Ibiza and Marbella enjoying sun, sea and cocktails with friends.

By contrast her former accomplice Melissa Reid, landed a charity job at Citizens Advice after she was released from jail in South America in June 2016.  

Michaella was also reportedly offered £250,000 for a tell-all book deal detailing her criminal exploits and time behind bars in Lima, although no details of the publication have been released. 

Whether that figure is realistic or not, the new mother will be releasing her tome at some point this year.

There was also talk of Michaella taking part in a prison documentary, although there has not been any news of the rumoured TV show. 

On confirming her pregnancy, her agent said: Michaella is looking forward to her journey into motherhood. 

'Couple this with the excitement of her book release and 2018 is set to be an amazing year for Michaella.'

The new mother announced her pregnancy this year by posting a black and white photo of her in Calvin Klein underwear that exposed an expanding tummy to reveal her happy news. 

Captioning the post, Michaella wrote: 'Wow had some crazy dreams... guess that's what happens when your dreaming for more than one.'
item.dc:abstract: EXCLUSIVE: The 'Peru Two' drugs mule, 24, was seen her the new arrivals - whose names she has not yet revealed - for a walk in a park near her home in Belfast on Tuesday. The former jailbird looked every inch the doting mother as she pushed the newborns around in a double pushchair before pausing for a cuddle on a park bench (right). Proudly displaying her post-baby body in a floral miniskirt from River Island teamed with a cosy red knit and flyknit trainers, Michaella couldn't wipe the smile from her face as she cosied up to her little bundles.

item.title: 'This show is so fake!' YouTube vloggers 'FORGET' their four-year relationship after being hypnotised for TV experiment - but viewers don't buy it
item.description: The Channel 4 show Hello Stranger sees couples temporarily relieved of all memory of their relationship through hypnosis, and left convinced they're single and looking for love.
item.content:encoded:
A couple of four years 'forgot' their entire relationship after being hypnotised for a TV experiment - but not everyone watching at home was convinced.   

YouTube vloggers Lucy D'Agostino, 20, and George Warrington, 24, who are behind The Juicy Vlog, were hypnotised by Aaron Calvert for the Channel 4 show Hello Stranger, which sees couples temporarily relieved of all memories of their relationship - and left convinced they're single and ready to mingle. 

While under hypnosis, they were each sent on dates with other people they'd been matched with based on their idea of the perfect partner, before going on a date with one another - effectively as strangers.  

At the end of the process they were told they were in a long-term relationship - a fact Lucy refused to believe until they were shown loved-up selfies to jog their memories.  

Lucy said on the show it was like 'falling in love again' as their happy memories together came flooding back. 

But suspicious viewers watching at home were quick to suggest all was not as it seems, with one tweeting simply: 'This show is so fake'

Another tweeted: 'Never seen anything so fake. How convienient that they both record vlogs on their relationship and are fame hungry [sic].'

While another added: 'Fake...fake...fake.. they clearly recognised each other, talked over each other and acted totally differently than on all other dates. Body language and conversation clearly relaxed and familiar. Give me a break

'This show is so fake. None of this is possible,' a third said.

Another wrote: 'What an utter pile of crap, so fake. Joke's on me for watching the entire thing. 

After four years as a couple Lucy and George both agreed that they had lost the fizz in their relationship.

They risked the future of their relationship to go on dates with two other people who matched the characteristics they regard as making up the ideal partner, before finally meeting each other as if for the first time to find out whether they could fall in love all over again.

Lucy complained that their relationship was exciting at first but says: 'When he texts me now it’s “can you pick up some milk on your way home”… 

'We need things to change, I don’t want to be one of them couples that are stuck in a rut.'

George said that life as a vlogger meant they weren't always honest with their audience: 'It’s like an addiction, it really is. It might look like we have the perfect life but actually it’s not like that all the time.

Lucy added: 'There is quite a lot of pressure to be this perfect couple online. It creates this artificial front to the rest of the world, if we film a video it needs to come across as happy.'

Aaron explained that about thirty per cent of people are more susceptible to hypnosis, with Lucy and George making the near-perfect candidates.

He went on to 'hide' their memories with some simple hypnosis techniques, take away their phones, and separate them for three days so they can experience single life.

Lucy met with two men who were both aware she was under hypnosis.

Explaining her single status on the dates, she said she has had several romances but nothing has stuck.

When George met with two girls who are both 'his type', he said he had brief dalliances with the opposite sex when he was away at university.

But when he and real-life love Lucy locked eyes, they both appeared smitten.  

They were asked to separately pick the person out of the three to go on a second date, but before their choice was revealed the hypnotist explained the truth.

Lucy and George both appeared confused when confronted with photos and keepsakes from their relationship, apparently unable to fathom how there is evidence when they 'had only just met'.

Eventually the hypnotist undoes the amnesia, as Lucy reflects: 'It’s a bit like we are falling in love all over again. It’s like we have pressed rewind. 

'It felt really good meeting him without any kind of baggage.'

Hello Stranger returns next Tuesday on Channel 4 at 10pm
item.dc:abstract: British YouTube vloggers Lucy D'Agostino, 20, and George Warrington, 24, who are behind The Juicy Vlog, were hypnotised by Aaron Calvert for the Channel 4 show Hello Stranger, which sees couples temporarily relieved of all memories of their relationship - and left convinced they're single and ready to mingle.
item.dc:creator: Kerry Mcdermott
item.mi:shortTitle: YouTube vloggers are hypnotised to FORGET their four-year relationship

item.title: Mother who ballooned to a size 22 sheds half her weight in just TEN MONTHS after switching to a high-fat diet - and claims she didn't exercise ONCE
item.description: Teresa Venetoulis, 32, from Sydney, shed half her body weight in less than a year, despite never exercising after embarking on the ketogenic diet, and now is a trim size 8.
item.content:encoded:
A mother-of-two has shed almost half her body weight in less than a year - without ever stepping in a gym. 

Teresa Venetoulis, 32, from Sydney, Australia, struggled to shift the pounds after the birth of her son Liam, nine, and daughter Faith, two, tipping the scales at 103kg (16st 2lbs) at her heaviest.

After 'trying everything' to lose weight, a doctor recommended Teresa, who wore a size 22, adopt the ketogenic diet, which eliminates all carbohydrates and focuses on meals that are high in fat and protein.

The stay-at-home mother said she was 'astounded' when she lost 15kg (2st 3lbs) in the first two months alone. 

In the 10 months since she started the diet, Teresa has lost 49kg (7st 7lbs) and now shows off her 54kg (8st 5lbs) figure in size 8 jeans.  

Teresa said: 'I'd never been overweight before and have always been naturally slim. But after giving birth to my son [Liam, now nine], my hormones went into overdrive, which made me pile on the weight really quickly.

'This then worsened my PCOS (polycystic ovary syndrome), which made it harder to lose weight. Within a year, I'd piled on 50kg and felt awful.

'I tried all the diets out there, went to the gym and ran every day, but it was no use - nothing worked. I kept putting on weight. 

'After I was pregnant with my daughter I reached 103kg, and nothing I did helped budge the weight. I would lose 2kg, but then gain 5kg. It was so frustrating.'

Teresa's diet before...  

Breakfast: Two cheese toasted sandwiches

Snack: Fruit and a biscuit

Lunch: Pasta or pizza

Dinner: Spaghetti bolognese, lasagne or roast dinner with potatoes

... and after

Breakfast: Eggs with avocado, spinach, mushrooms and bacon

Late lunch/dinner: Large plate of grilled chicken or baked fish with lots of vegetables or large salad

Occasional treat: Low-carb Keto cake 

 

Teresa's doctor explained the ketogenic diet might help regulate her hormones, making it easier for her to lose weight. 

With her only other option being a cocktail of medication, Teresa felt she had nothing to lose and decided to go try the ketogenic diet in June 2017.

The strict diet requires cutting out all carbs in favor of high protein, high fat foods such as oily fish, lean meat, nuts, avocados and eggs.

And the mother admits she was astounded to drop 15kg (2st 3lbs) in the first two months after seven years of 'trying everything' to lose weight.

Teresa said: 'I'd never heard of the ketogenic diet before, so spent a month researching before I decided to give it a go.

'In the first two months, I lost 15kg. I was astounded. Nothing had ever worked before.

'I just kept going with it, and the weight just melted off. I ditched all carbs and focused on high protein and high healthy fats.

'It's always drilled into us to go low fat or fat free, but our body needs good, healthy fats.

'It's the best diet I've ever tried. Now it's a lifestyle choice.' 

Teresa claims the only exercise she does each day is 'incidental', such as housework, roaming around the shops and walking her children to school.

She also practices intermittent fasting, meaning she eats all her calories for the day in just two large meals at 11am and 2pm.

Teresa said: 'I'll have breakfast at around 11am, and then I'll eat again at 2pm. Then I'll fast until the next morning. It was hard at first, but your body just gets used to it.

'I still feed my kids their three meals and snacks a day as usual. 

'The meals are large, and I'm getting all the calories I need without constantly snacking. I feel fantastic now that I've lost all the weight.

'It wasn't just about slimming down, but it was about being healthy and the best mum I could be.

'Now I can run around after my kids easily. I'm less moody, and I have so much more energy 'I have so much confidence and I've never felt better.'
item.dc:abstract: Teresa Venetoulis, 32, from Sydney, Australia, struggled to shift the pounds after the birth of her son Liam, nine, and daughter Faith, two, tipping the scales at 103kg (16st 2lbs) at her heaviest (left and second from left). After 'trying everything' to lose weight, a doctor recommended Teresa adopt the ketogenic diet, which eliminates all carbohydrates and focuses on meals that are high in fat and protein. The stay-at-home mother has lost 49kg (7st 7lbs) and now wears a size 8.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Linning
item.mi:shortTitle: Mother sheds half her weight after switching to the ketogenic diet

item.title: Actress Busy Philipps breaks down in emotional Instagram video about her sinus pain, while revealing she's been picking her face due to stress, after detailing a lifelong battle with anxiety
item.description: The actress, 38, took to Instagram on Tuesday night to share her distress as she started suffering from sinus pain again — just two weeks after getting surgery to remedy the situation.
item.content:encoded:
Busy Philipps turned to Instagram Stories on Tuesday night as she started suffering form sinus pain again — a mere two weeks after getting surgery to solve the issue.

The actress, 38, broke down as she explained she wasn't feeling well, telling her viewers:  'Guys. My nose is stuffy. I'm trying not to cry because I know it's going to make it worse, but my sinuses hurt. F**k.'

She was so distressed by the pain and the thought she might struggle with sinus infections again despite the surgical procedure that she picked at her face, a behavior some people resort to in times of significant stress.

Scroll down for video 

'But I don't feel well,' she added. 'Also I picked my face, which is stupid because I'm working tomorrow. I've got a lot of mascara under my [eyes].'

Busy, who lives in Los Angeles with her husband, screenwriter Marc Silverstein, 46, and their daughters Birdie, nine, and Cricket, four, is currently in New York City and was due to film a television segment on Wednesday morning.

Back on Tuesday night, she wanted to take a bath, hoping it would make her feel better, but — as she explained in a baffled tone — there was only 'burning hot' water coming out of the pipes in her bathroom.

'There's a guy here trying to fix the water now. [I feel] really bad about the picking my face. It's so stupid. I know better. F**k. F**k,' she added.

The man working on her bathroom later came back, this time with a ladder, much to Busy's surprise. 

'I don't know why he needs a ladder to fix the water,' she commented, before adding in another update: 'Well, he fixed the water. Maybe I can try to take a bath. Maybe it will make me feel better. 

'Oh, God. What a bummer. And also [points at her forehead], f**k, Busy, come on.' 

Busy was distressed that she had picked at the skin on her face, especially hours before she was scheduled to be on camera. 

'So I picked right in the middle of my forehead, which is, you know, exactly where you want to pick when you're going to be on TV,' she said.

'And I'm so insanely stuffy that I think maybe the psychic was right, it's just trapped tears and frustration.

'And you know what? You can't cut out trapped tears and frustration with surgery. You have to deal with it. So maybe I should.'

The actress shared a sweet text from her mother advising her to take a deep breath and take a bath, and telling her she had probably caught a cold due to flying and temperature changes, resulting in sinus pain.

On Wednesday morning, Busy, who was out at 6 am, told her followers she was alright in a new video. 

'Guys, I'm OK. It's a new day,' she said. 'Sorry I had a panic attack on Instagram Stories last night. I'm going to be fine. I'll cover my picked face. Not a big deal.

'My mom was right. I probably just got a little cold from traveling and everything. Change of weather. And it doesn't mean I'm doomed to sinus infections for the rest of my life or that I have trapped tears.'

After her sinus surgery last month, Busy shared a photo of herself in a wheelchair with a bandage on her nose, giving a thumbs-up.

'My post sinus surgery look was [fire],' Busy joked about her outfit, which consisted in track pants, a sweater, and Uggs.

'Also. I apparently was giving a lot of thumbs-up. Thank you for your good thoughts and kind words! I'm in bed in Mr nightgown resting with my sinuses successfully cleaned out.'

Just last week, Busy opened up about her lifelong struggle with anxiety as she urged others to seek help in a new video.

The actress explained in the clip, shot for the Child Mind Institute, that she has battled with anxiety for most of her life since she was a child, and that she was able to get help after she started talking about her issues. 

'I have had anxiety for as long as I can remember, since I was a kid,' she said.

'I used to lie awake in bed at night and I would have spinning thoughts and it would be really hard for me to get to sleep.

'I would be so scared that I wouldn't even go to my parent's room and I didn't want to tell them what was happening because I thought there was something wrong with me.'

She explained how opening up about her struggles enabled her to get the help she needed, telling others there is no shame in reaching out.

'It turns out that there's nothing wrong with me,' she added.

'Once I was able to start talking about it, it relieved a lot of the anxiety and I was able to get help. Therapy and sometimes medication, which there's nothing wrong with that either.

'So anyway, I guess I would have liked to tell my younger self not to be embarrassed or ashamed and to open up and to talk about what's happening because once you have the realization that what you're going through is something that a lot of people struggle with, it feels kind of incredible to know that you're not alone.

'So, you're not alone.'

Busy has become known for her candid Instagram videos, whether they're about her children or remembering her old friend Heath Ledger who passed away ten years ago on January 22, 2008.

In a series of videos posted back in April, Busy broke down in tears admitting that she left her nine-year-old daughter's teddy bear in their Hawaii hotel.

'I'm so glad I was able to be a part of Child Mind Institute's My Younger Self campaign,' Busy wrote on Instagram while sharing the video of herself discussing anxiety. 

'I love the work they do and since May is Mental Health Awareness month, there's no better time to share. It's important to talk about this stuff in order to de-stigmatize it! Especially so that kids know there's no shame is asking for help.'
item.dc:abstract: The actress, 38, took to Instagram on Tuesday night to share her distress as she started suffering from sinus pain again — just two weeks after getting surgery to remedy the situation. 'Guys. My nose is stuffy. I'm trying not to cry because I know it's going to make it worse, but my sinuses hurt. F**k,' she said. Busy was so distressed that she picked at her face, a behavior some people resort to in times of significant stress. The actress (pictured inset on Monday at the CFDA Fashion Awards in Brooklyn), who lives in Los Angeles, is currently in New York City and was due to film a television segment on Wednesday morning.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston

item.title: Seeing double! High school yearbook photo goes viral after twin stands in for his brother on picture day with hilarious results
item.description: Marcus Williams, from Greenville, South Carolina, shared the snap of his and his brother's portraits side-by-side on the class page, revealing his brother Malcolm had posed for both on picture day.
item.content:encoded:
A former high school student's yearbook photo has gone viral after he revealed his identical twin brother stood in for him for picture day.

Marcus Williams, from Greenville, South Carolina, took to Twitter on Tuesday to share the snap of his and his brother's portraits side-by-side on the class page, with their names beneath their respective images.

In the caption Mr Williams revealed the man in his photo was actually his brother, Malcolm Williams, who had taken his place because he was sick that day. 

He wrote: 'My twin is the GOAT [greatest of all time]. He tool both of our pics for picture day back in HS [high school] when I was sick.' 

Malcom is seen wearing the same smart suit and bow-tie in both images, although he smiled for his own photo and wore a solemn look for his brother's shot.

The hilarious prank won Marcus widespread praise on social media - with thousands of users retweeting the post.   

One wrote: 'Twins are so lit. Switching places seems so fun I'm so jealous'. 

Another added: 'How did I know the one absent would be on the right, he saved the smile for himself.'

A third added: 'I love this! My brothers are twins, my nephews, and my great nephews. I've always been jealous I wasn't a twin.'

Many praised the brothers' bond, with one tweeting: 'What an incredible sibling you have!! Bet that is such a fond memory for you both when you're reminiscing.' 

Other twins shared stories of times when they had played similar jokes.   

One wrote: 'Got twin sisters. Like these, identical twins. They used to switch classes back in jr high and high school. NONE of the teachers could tell the difference. Never got caught. Our mom heard them laughing about it and the jig was up!'

And another admitted: 'I know these other gal twins. They use each others passports, identity cards, driving license' (sic).

Meanwhile one added: 'My sister and I are almost 2 years apart and I don't even think we look alike. Went to a bar and she forgot her ID. Showed mine. Went in a sec while she 'looked thru her purse'. Came our and palmed her mine. She 'found' it and got in.'
item.dc:abstract: Marcus Williams, from Greenville, South Carolina, took to Twitter on Tuesday to share the snap of his and his brother's portraits side-by-side on the yearbook class page (left), with their names beneath their respective images. In the caption (inset) Mr Williams revealed the man in his photo was actually his brother, Malcolm Williams, who had taken his place because he was sick that day. The hilarious prank won Marcus widespread praise on social media. Pictured right, Marcus (left) and Malcolm today.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Linning
item.mi:shortTitle: Photo goes viral after twin stands in for his brother on picture day

item.title: Would YOU wear them? Fashion brand loved by celebrities including Gigi Hadid offers VERY daring jeans which can only be worn WITHOUT underwear (and they'll set you back $590)
item.description: The barely-there trousers from American retailer Opening Ceremony - which counts Gigi Hadid and Rihanna among its fans - feature mesh side panels that run down the entire side of the leg.
item.content:encoded:
A fashion brand loved by trend-setters has launched a pair of jeans that can only be worn without underwear. 

The barely-there trousers from American retailer Opening Ceremony - which counts Gigi Hadid and Rihanna among its fans - feature mesh side panels that run down the  entire side of the leg.

They were originally sold for an eye-watering $590 (£468) but are currently on sale for $236 (£187.46) via the brand's website. 

The loose-fit jeans appear normal from the front and the back, with sturdy denim pockets and seams. 

However once the wearer turns to their side, the daring mesh panels are put on show.

They would have to go without underwear in order to have the full effect - and be wary of making any sudden movements, or risk flashing more than they wanted.

The jeans are the latest in a string of boundary-pushing designs by Opening Ceremony.

Gigi Hadid was spotted wearing a pair of the brand's bizarre detachable hot pant jeans to a magazine launch in New York last year. 

The brand also released a pair of 'detachable button down pants' consist of nothing more than two denim trouser legs attached to a waist belt by suspenders, leaving the bottom completely exposed.

The crotchless design, a collaboration from the brand with French clothing house Y Project, are now sold out.

Slashed jeans have also become more popular on the high street, with retailers including ASOS selling styles with daring cut-outs.

A pair by Ragged Priest Chaps featured a belt connected to a pair of chaps by chain - leaving the wearer's entire derrière on display.
item.dc:abstract: The barely-there trousers from American retailer Opening Ceremony - which counts Gigi Hadid (inset) and Rihanna among its fans - look like normal jeans from the front and back (right) but feature mesh side panels that run down the entire side of the leg (seen left). They were originally sold for an eye-watering $590 (£468) but are currently on sale for $236 (£187.46) via the brand's website. It is the latest in a string of boundary-pushing designs by the retailer.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Linning

item.title: 'He will be so very proud of you': Laura Kenny receives an outpouring of support after admitting she struggles with 'mum guilt' for leaving her baby son while training
item.description: The Essex-born cycling star, 26, a four-time Olympic champion, took to Instagram to ask followers if the 'mum guilt' over leaving her son Albert, nine months, will ever go away.
item.content:encoded:
Four-time Olympic champion Laura Kenny has admitted she suffers 'mum guilt' when she leaves her son Albert, nine months, in a very honest Instagram post. 

The Essex-born cycling star, 26, who welcomed her first child in August 2017 shared a snap of her cuddling her son after returning from training, saying she was 'straight back in mummy mode'.

'Nine months old and I still get mum guilt. Will I ever not feel guilty for leaving him?' she asked. 

The athlete, who is married to fellow cyclist Jason Kenny, 30, received an outpouring of support from followers who reassured her that her feelings are normal.

'He will be so very proud of you when he is older,' one wrote. 'Just remember the amazing example you're showing him and the importance of demonstrating to him what you can achieve when you work hard.' 

Others told Laura that the guilt will never subside, but assured her that it would make their time together feel more precious. 

And one commented that time apart from your child makes you a better parent as you have the space to be yourself and then feel more present when you're reunited. 

Laura and Jason, a six-time Olympic gold medallist welcomed Albert Louie Kenny in August 2017. 

She became Britain’s most successful female Olympian in 2016 when she won omnium and team pursuit titles for the second time in Rio.

The following month she married fellow cycling champion Jason and in February 2017 the pair announced they were expecting a baby in a social media post showing two adult bikes and a small child’s bike. 

Laura already declared her intention to compete at a third Olympic Games in Tokyo in 2020 and returned to cycling just over six months after Albert's arrival, after being selected for the UCI Track Cycling World Championships.

She and the Great Britain team went on to qualify second fastest in the women's team pursuit, and went on to win silver.
item.dc:abstract: The Essex-born cycling star, 26, a four-time Olympic champion, took to Instagram to ask followers if the 'mum guilt' over leaving her son Albert, nine months, will ever go away. Laura, who became Britain’s most successful female Olympian in 2016 when she won omnium and team pursuit titles for the second time in Rio (left) returned to the track when her son was six-months-old.
item.dc:creator: Siofra Brennan
item.mi:shortTitle: Cyclist Laura Kenny admits to battling with mum guilt

item.title: The secrets to success: 24-year-old college dropout reveals how she went from living on food stamps to earning six figures in just ONE YEAR
item.description: Lifestyle blogger, Alyse, 24, dropped out of college to pursue her dreams of living in Hawaii arriving with just $500 to her name leading her to need food stamps but now she makes six figures.
item.content:encoded:
A 24-year-old college dropout has revealed how she went from living on food stamps to earning six figures in just 12 months.

Alyse Brautigam, a lifestyle blogger and the founder of healthy-living website Raw Alignment, shared her tips for success in a candid video posted to her YouTube channel, explained that she was left with little money after she decided to drop out of college and pursue her dream of moving to Hawaii so she could focus on her personal website.  

The blogger and YouTuber, who is originally from Connecticut, detailed five things that have helped her go from living on next to nothing  to making hundreds of thousands in just one year: taking action, getting creative, accepting help, prioritizing health and believing in yourself.

Scroll down for video 

She shared that she has always struggled with money because she grew up with the belief that money equals stress and struggle which is how she felt when she packed up her things to move to Hawaii and live in a van. 

Admitting that she would constantly have daydreams of living in a world that didn't involve money she would repeat two money mantras in her head over and over again - 'I am worthy of living in abundance' and 'life is easier and more fun with an abundance of money.' 

Alyse said she would write them down, vocalize them and think about them non-stop until eventually it sunk in. 

Describing how these two mantras eventually led her to making tons of money she explains in a new YouTube video that she dropped out of college and sold almost everything that she owned so that she could buy a flight to Hawaii and when she got there she landed on a fruit farm which was her first destination and only had $500 to her name.

While working and living on the farm she got on food stamps and was on them for six months with the support of the government and exactly one year after that she earned her first six figure salary.

She shared the 'mindset shifts and action steps' that she took that allowed her to make six figures exactly a year later admitting that she wishes she knew this information when she was first getting started.

The first thing she did was take action without needing the approval of friends family or society confessing that for at least a year before she decided to take action she was desperately seeking approval of other people.

The second thing she did was get creative in pursuing her passions. She said that you should always dream big and ask yourself - 'What if your life could be anything that you wanted it to be? What if you could achieve anything that you set your mind to?'

Alyse said it was a lot of trial and error as well as experimenting with new things but she tries to think of everything as a learning experience because, 'even if something didn't do so well there's always something I can learn from it.'

A very important piece of the puzzle that has allowed Alyse to continue growing and expanding she admits is accepting help which she has done a lot over the past few years.

'I have accepted help from so many different people in so many different ways. The truth is that I haven't done this all on my own that's just not possible. When we open up ourselves and accept help from others we're also opening up ourselves to so much more growth.'

As for people who are too scared to ask for help, Alyse said, 'I know that it could be hard to ask for support and accept help from others but if we want to grow at a more rapid rate it's essential to allow yourself to receive help.'

Fourth is prioritizing health which she says is so important when it comes to manifesting your dreams and achieving your goals.

'Nutrition is incredibly important because fueling and nourishing your body will help you thrive. Less process food and more fresh food as well as figuring out how many hours of sleep is ideal for you and getting in tune with your body is essential she says. 

'When I'm feeling good in my mind as well as my body and I feel like I have a clear head, I feel like things manifest and happen so much quicker and easier,' she admits.

Lastly, Alyse says believing in yourself is key as well as becoming aware of your limiting beliefs.

'I have spent years trying to get those limiting thoughts and beliefs out of my head. Change the voice in your head and change the story. I can't stress enough how important it is to positively affirm what you are capable of instead of telling yourself that you're not worthy, you're not capable and you're not deserving,' Alyse shared.

'You literally need to train yourself to think differently and more positively even if it feels like a lie in the beginning continue on with it anyway. Every single day wake up and tell yourself "I am capable and I am worthy of living in abundance and fulfillment in every single aspect of life,"' she continued.
item.dc:abstract: Alyse Brautigam dropped out of college to pursue her dreams of living in Hawaii arriving with just $500 to her name. After living on food stamps for six months, the blogger, who is from Connecticut, began earning a sizable amount of money - simply by following five steps. The five things that have helped her grow are: taking action, getting creative, accepting help, prioritizing health and believing in yourself.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Woman reveals how she went from food stamps to making six figures

item.title: There was no danger of upstaging the bride! Danish actress Emma Leth wows in a VERY dramatic hat and totally SHEER dress on her wedding day
item.description: Actress and model Emma Leth, 27, opted for the bold bridal look as she tied the knot with artist fiancé Tal Rosenzweig in an outdoor ceremony in Paris. She wore an enormous straw hat with a lace dress.
item.content:encoded:
Danish actress Emma Leth wowed in a dramatic hat and a completely sheer lace dress on her wedding day.

Emma, 27, opted for a bold bridal look as she tied the knot with artist fiancé Tal Rosenzweig in a romantic outdoor ceremony in Paris.

The actress and model made sure all eyes were on her by wearing an enormous straw hat by French designer Jacquemus, teamed with a floor-length white dress.

The daring lace number featured a cowl neckline and buttons down the back, while revealing her lilac underwear worn beneath.

Emma finished off her unusual wedding outfit with a pair of elegant gold earrings and blue polka dot heels, while opting for an elegant bridal bouquet.

Sharing photographs of her big day on Instagram, Emma wrote: 'We got married yesterday and my new name is emma rosenzweig. 

'Thank you for the beautiful @jacquemus hat @birgerchristensen' 

Her striking wedding look was met with delight by fans, who praised her for her bold fashion choices.

One wrote: 'Omg so obsessed with you and your gorgeous wedding look!!'

Another added: 'This bridal look is blowing my mind.' 

The actress - who has previously modelled for Balenciaga - shared a series of sweet pictures from her big day, including a shot of her sharing a kiss with new husband Tal.

Tal, 51, wore a navy pinstripe suit with a buttoned up white shirt underneath, accessorising with a baseball cap.

Emma also shared a touching family shot of her and Tal with their one-year-old son Abel. 

The mother-of-one has starred has starred in a number of Danish films and TV programmes, and has now turned her hand to film-making.

Emma has also made a name for herself in her fashion world, after walking the catwalk during Balenciaga's AW17 show last March.

She appeared in the show just three months after she had her son, before starring in an ad campaign for the brand.

Speaking previously about her love of fashion, Emma told Vogue: 'I think good style is very close to bad style. It has to be very, very close.

'And also, no matter how rich you are, it’s not like you can buy style.'
item.dc:abstract: Actress and model Emma Leth, 27, (left, and right with new husband Tal and son Abel) opted for the bold bridal look as she tied the knot with artist fiancé Tal Rosenzweig in a romantic outdoor ceremony in Paris. The actress and model made sure all eyes were on her by wearing an enormous straw hat (inset) by French designer Jacquemus, teamed with a floor-length white dress. The daring lace number featured a cowl neckline and buttons down the back, while revealing her lilac underwear worn beneath.

item.title: Who needs the sofa? Strongman Eddie 'the Beast' Hall hoists Holly AND Phil onto his shoulders live on air on This Morning
item.description: Eddie Hall, 30, from Newcastle-under-Lyme, demonstrated his astonishing strength by hoisting the This Morning presenters onto his shoulders on Wednesday's show.
item.content:encoded:
Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield had a very peculiar start to This Morning on Wednesday.

The hosts started the programme by being lifted into the air simultaneously by the man named the strongest in the world last year.

Perched on Eddie Hall's shoulders, Holly and Phil tried to keep their faces straight as they told viewers what was coming up on the ITV chat show.

During his appearance on the show Eddie, 30, from Newcastle-under-Lyme, spoke about the training involved in becoming so buff, and revealed he eats 12,500 calories a day to maintain his 27 stone physique - before bending a frying pan with his bare hands to demonstrate his heft. 

To viewers at home Holly and Phil looked as though they were standing with their arms around each other as they spoke about the schedule.

But when the camera zoomed out, it became clear they were actually perching on Hall's shoulders - and clinging on to one another for balance.  

Phil said: 'Don't forget we've got last year's World's Strongest Man as well.'

'I cant wait to meet him as anyone seen him yet?' Holly said. 

Eddie, a former lorry maintenance worker, beat 29 other men to become the world's strongest man in the competition held in Botswana in May last year.

He was the first Briton to win the world title since Gary Taylor 25 years ago.

The father-of-two competed in a number of events, including pulling a plane and carrying five Atlas Stones of various weights, up to 210 kg (463 lb). 

On This Morning today he revealed the vigorous regime he has to follow to maintain his strength.

As part of his 12,500 calories he eats two full English breakfasts, which include five sausages each. 

He has to train four hours a a day and have physiotherapy as his job can put his health in danger.

When he lifted his heaviest weight of 500kg he had a brain bleed and blood came out of his eyes, nose and ears.

Eddie said: 'To be the best at any sport you've got to take risks and there's always consequences, but if I could go back in time and do it again I would.'

Viewers were wowed by Eddie's appearance on the show on Wednesday.

One tweeted: 'If only I was a ''professional strongman'' would love to justify the full English breakfast x 4 everyday! Sounds amazing.'

'Imagining annoying him and meeting him in a dark alley,' another posted, followed by laughing emojis.

A third said: 'I usually scoff at people finding bodybuilders attractive, but helllllo...'
item.dc:abstract: Eddie Hall, 30, from Newcastle-under-Lyme, demonstrated his astonishing strength by hoisting the This Morning presenters onto his shoulders on Wednesday's show. He also bent a frying pan with his bare hands (inset) to show off the results of his gruelling training regime and 12,500 calorie per day diet.
item.dc:creator: Kerry Mcdermott
item.mi:shortTitle: Holly and Phil are both LIFTED in the air by the World's Strongest Man

item.title: 'My body was changing and it made me feel out of control': Riverdale star Camila Mendes details her struggle with eating disorders, admitting she used to be 'obsessed with being thin'
item.description: Riverdale star, Cami, 23, stars on the cover of the June 2018 Marie Claire Malaysia issue where she confesses she dealt with eating disorders in her past and how she managed to overcome it.
item.content:encoded:
Camila Mendes opened up about battling with an eating disorder and how she managed to push through it. 

The Riverdale star dished to Marie Claire Malaysia about her ongoing battle with body image, confidence and positivity, while also posing on the cover of the June 2018 issue.

Speaking about her struggle to accept her body, the 23-year-old confessed, 'When I grew up, I was obsessed with being thin. I always wanted to be lean and then I went to college,' where she said she gained weight.

'I noticed my body was changing and it made me feel out of control but I didn't understand it.

'I thought I was just gaining a lot of weight… at that time there weren't many voices out there that championed curvier body types,' Cami admitted.

However, she shares that it wasn't until models such as Ashley Graham began trailblazing the industry that she started to accept who she was.

'Now, we see models like Ashley who are encouraging women to embrace being unique and that made me let go of the standard that was established so long ago – that thin is the only type of beautiful,' Cami said.

Something that not a lot of people know about Cami is that when she was growing up her sister battled with a serious eating disorder for many years and had to go to rehab for awhile.

This is part of the reason she chose to work with Project Heal, an organization that raises awareness about eating disorders, because she shared that she feels strongly about the issue.

Cami shared, 'I think the biggest message through Project Heal is to let the public know just how high the costs really are to get treatment and how an eating disorder is not recognized as a mental illness when in fact, it is one of the deadliest mental illnesses there is.'

'There is the common misconception that when you have an eating disorder, you are really skinny and that is not the case at all, it's actually quite the opposite,' she admits.

Camila continued to the magazine, 'People don't know that you don't necessarily have to look like you have an eating disorder to have one and because I was never that skinny, I never thought that I did have the disorder.'

This is certainly not the first time that Camila has spoken up about her body issues and she even posted a photo to Instagram back in October detailing her past struggles with eating disorders.

'I'm done believing in the idea that there's a thinner, happier version of me on the other side of all the tireless effort,' she said in her post.

Camila also went on to share with her followers how she's officially done with dieting because she doesn't want to feel ashamed of her body anymore.

Aside from Cami, Riverdale co-star Lili Reinhart has also spoken a lot about body image and confidence, especially most recently when people were accusing her of being pregnant.

The 21-year-old admits that the pregnancy rumors had an effect on her, 'It did take a hit to my self-esteem for a second and then I kind of picked myself back up and said, "I'm not going to let this ruin my day!"'

She has also spoken up about her cystic acne many times in the past year, specifically about how her acne led to body dysmorphia and she would even put her makeup on in the dark because she couldn't look at herself. 

Lili told Seventeen, 'I developed slight body dysmorphia - when I would break out, I couldn't look at myself in the mirror for a couple of months at a time.

'I remember doing my make-up before school in the dark, which is an awful idea, but it's because I didn't want to see myself in that bright light,' she admitted.
item.dc:abstract: Cami, 23, stars on the cover of the June 2018 Marie Claire Malaysia issue where she confesses she dealt with eating disorders in her past. The Riverdale star admits that she was always fixated on being skinny and even her sister battled with a disorder which she had to go to rehab for. It wasn't until curvier women and models spoke up about embracing their bodies that Camila finally felt comfortable in her own skin.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Camila Mendes opens up about battle with eating disorders

item.title: 'I’ve never identified as a "daddy’s little princess" type of girl': Married women reveal why they walked themselves down the aisle on their wedding days - just like royal bride Meghan Markle
item.description: Leah Melby Clinton, Abby Sherwood, and Mallory Cooke shared the reasons why they opted to walk themselves down the aisle on their wedding days, and they all believe they made the right decision.
item.content:encoded:
Meghan Markle made a feminist statement and British royal wedding history when she walked down the first half of the aisle by herself, but she's not the only bride who has opted to go it alone.

Three married women have revealed the reasons why they decided to buck tradition and walk themselves down the aisle on their wedding days — and they all believe they made the right decision.

Speaking with Elle.com, New Yorker Leah Melby Clinton, 32, the site's director of branded editorial strategy, explained that her parents divorced when she was very young, and she didn't want to hurt her mother's feeling by having only her father walk her down the aisle. 

She admitted that she didn't aesthetically like the look of having a parent on each side of her, and she also thought it would be awkward for all three of them to try and squeeze down the aisle together. 

'I’ve never identified as a "daddy’s little princess" type of girl, and the tradition of being given away doesn’t square with me,' she added, noting that she and her husband had already lived together for a few years before they got married.  

'The decision to get married was us, as two adults, deciding something — I wasn’t going from having my father take care of me to having my husband take care of me,' she explained. 'I can take care of myself, and walking alone felt like the surest physical way to show that.'

Meanwhile, Abby Sherwood, 33, from Massachusetts, said she knew she would be walking down the aisle solo because her parents didn't support her decision to marry her wife, Katie, due to religious reasons. 

Like Leah, she also pointed out that she had never been a 'daddy's girl,' so doing away with the tradition on her big day didn't really bother her. However, it was important for Katie to have her parents walk her down the aisle.

For their garden wedding ceremony, they arranged the chairs to create three aisles. At the start of the ceremony, the brides simultaneously walked down the far left and far right aisles: Katie with her parents and Abby by herself. 

After they said 'I do,' they walked down the middle aisle together.   

'I remember feeling calm, steady, empowered, and — as vain as it might sound —really beautiful in my princess gown,' Abby said. 'I remember smiling and being really happy. I've never doubted that it was the right decision for me.' 

For Mallory Cooke, 31, who is from Tennessee and attended college in Boston, the decision to walk by herself was about keeping her late father's memory alive on her wedding day in 2013. 

Her father passed away in 2006 after being diagnosed with colon cancer. Although her mother remarried and she loves her stepfather, Mallory said she felt like her real dad was the only one who should walk down the aisle with her.

'I carried a single red rose in my all white bouquet in honor of my dad,' she said. 'I put the rose on an empty chair in the front row next to my mom before meeting my now-husband at the altar. 

'We explained what the rose meant and what I was doing in our wedding program. My dad couldn’t physically be there that day, but I always carry him in my heart.'
item.dc:abstract: Three married women have revealed the reasons why they decided to buck tradition and walk themselves down the aisle on their wedding days — and they all believe they made the right decision. New Yorker Leah Melby Clinton, 32, said she walked down the aisle solo because her parents divorced when she was young, and she didn't want to hurt either of their feelings. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Abby Sherwood's parents didn't support her decision to marry her wife due to religious reasons, so she walked herself down the aisle. For Mallory Cooke, 31, who is from Tennessee, the decision to walk by herself was about keeping her late father's memory alive. At her wedding to Prince Harry, Meghan, 36, walked down the first half of the aisle by herself, before she was joined by Prince Charles.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Three brides reveal why they walked themselves down the aisle

item.title: Maxima and the mother-in-law! Glamorous Queen of the Netherlands joins Princess Beatrix for prize giving ceremony at Noordeinde Palace
item.description: Queen Maxima, 46 and Princess Beatrix, 80, The two women were attending the 'Appeltjes van Oranje' (Apples of Orange) awards at the Noordeinde Palace, The Hague, on Wednesday.
item.content:encoded:
Queen Maxima joined her mother-in-law Princess Beatrix for a prize giving ceremony at Noordeinde Palace on Wednesday.

The Dutch Queen looked her elegant best as she joined King Willem-Alexander's mother at the Hague.

In honour of the occasion Maxima, 46, dressed up in a glamorous lilac gown featuring draping detail around the shoulder.

She added several dazzling accessories in the form of a diamond brooch pinned to her lapel along with pearl drop earrings. 

Coordinating her outfit further she opted for a pair of heeled sandals in the same shade as her dress and carried a matching satin clutch.

She swept her famous blonde tresses into a low chignon and stuck to a makeup palette of earthy tones. 

Meanwhile Princess Beatrix, 80, looked elegant in a baby blue skirt and jacket complete with a grey print. 

The two women were attending the 'Appeltjes van Oranje' (Apples of Orange) awards to Dutch social initiatives who help connect people from different backgrounds and cultures. 

The award is normally presented by King Willem, however, in his absence Queen Maxima took his place today. 

The Appeltje van Oranje consists of a prize of €15,000 and a bronze statue made by Princess Beatrix.   

This prize from the Oranje Fonds, of which Queen Maxima is patron, is the prize for initiatives that ensure that people participate in our society. 

The three winners were chosen from twelve nominees and they will be presented their prizes today.

Maxima appeared to be in high spirits as she presented the awards - seemingly taking a small bow of respect before handing them over. 

Following the ceremony the royals and the winners gathered in a reception room where they posed for a commemorative photograph.
item.dc:abstract: Queen Maxima, 46 and Princess Beatrix, 80, The two women were attending the 'Appeltjes van Oranje' (Apples of Orange) awards to Dutch social initiatives who help connect people from different backgrounds and cultures. The Appeltje van Oranje consists of a prize of €15,000 and a bronze statue made by Princess Beatrix.

item.title: M&S hires child models with disabilities including a girl with cerebral palsy and her identical twin sister - for a new school uniform campaign that celebrates diversity
item.description: Identical twins nine-year-old Lottie and Becca Carey, from Cheshire, were thrilled to model together for the first time in the high street chain's Life Isn't Uniform back to school adverts.
item.content:encoded:
Marks & Spencer has hired identical twin sisters - one with cerebral palsy - as the faces of their new school uniform campaign.

Nine-year-old Lottie and Becca Carey, from Cheshire, were thrilled to model together for the first time in the high street chain's Life Isn't Uniform back to school adverts.

Pretty Becca, who has spastic cerebral palsy which affects all her limbs and uses a walking frame and wheel chair, loved appearing in front of the camera with her sister.

The girls belong to Zebedee Management, which specialises in working with clients with disabilities, and joined a group of 30 children for the fashion shoot in a park.

The campaign also featured two other children from Zebedee, Cora Bishop, seven, who has Down's Syndrome and Teddy Berriman, six, who has cerebral palsy and epilepsy.

Teddy, from Country Durham, has cerebral palsy which affects all four of his limbs. He is also partially sighted, has epilepsy and uses a frame or wheelchair to move around.

Mum Nicola Short said: 'He absolutely loves modelling and tells all his friends. He loves the camera and getting lots of attention. 

'They covered him in water for the shoot, as if it was raining, which he really enjoyed.

'He has done several other shoots too, including a CBeebies programme and an advert for BBC1. 

'We're very proud of him and gives him a real sense of achievement. His confidence and self-esteem have really grown and he has a great 'I can do' attitude.'

Cora, from Wrexham in North Wales, has Downs Syndrome and her mum, Sheryl Bishop, said she the little girl loved her day in the spotlight.

She said: 'We are so proud of her and she found it really fun. The shoot was done in a park which she loved so she was in her element.

'To her it was a day in the spotlight and very exciting. It's something different for her to try and she gets a sense of pride when people say she is a model.'

Ryan Becker, head of kidswear marketing at M&S said: 'Getting your kids' school uniform right matters to busy parents, which makes Back to School a key campaign for M&S.

'Our new campaign, 'life isn't uniform' aims to have some fun and inspire confidence so it was great to work with such a diverse bunch of models. 

'We might be biased but we think all the kids, including Becca, Lottie, Teddy and Cora from Zebedee, look amazing and are great ambassadors for M&S.'

Laura Johnson and Zoe Proctor, of Zebedee Management, said: 'Marks and Spencer are using differently abled Zebedee Models in their school uniform campaign.

'Our model kids, Cora, Teddy and Rebecca and Charlotte, who have Down Syndrome, Cerebral Palsy and are wheelchair users are currently featured on the M&S website.

'All the models with disabilities are booked through Zebedee. It was a delight to supply some of our incredibly talented and beautiful children for such a high street giant!

'It's so wonderful diversity and inclusivity matter to big brands and they are coming to Zebedee Management to get the right children for the job.'
item.dc:abstract: Nine-year-old Lottie and Becca Carey, from Cheshire (left), were thrilled to model together for the first time in the high street chain's Life Isn't Uniform back to school adverts. Becca has spastic cerebral palsy and uses a walking frame and a wheelchair. Cora Bishop, seven, who has Down's Syndrome (right) and Teddy Berriman, six, who has cerebral palsy and epilepsy (inset).
item.dc:creator: Siofra Brennan
item.mi:shortTitle: M&S hires child models with disabilities for school uniform campaign

item.title: Fit for a (teen) queen! Fuller House star Lori Loughlin's YouTube star daughter Olivia, 18, takes cameras on a tour of her lavish bedroom, huge bathroom, and luxury designer-filled closet
item.description: Olivia's mom Lori, 53, (right) is a famous actress, while her father Mossimo Giannulli, 54, is the designer behind the brand Mossimo. The YouTube star showed her closet to her followers.
item.content:encoded:
Lori Loughlin's daughter Olivia Jade has revealed her beautiful bedroom, lavish designer-filled wardrobe and product-stuffed bathroom to her followers on YouTube. 

The 18-year-old YouTube star unveiled her extravagant lifestyle in hopes that some of her followers might be inspired to purchase looks similar to her own in anticipation of the summer months. 

Included in the must-have buys were two Gucci sweaters, a Dolce and Gabbana dress and Gucci loafers, together valued at an estimated $6,330.

Scroll down for video 

Olivia's mom Lori, 53, is best known for her role as Rebecca Donaldson-Katsopolis on the sitcom Full House and its sequel Fuller House, while her father Mossimo Giannulli, 55, is the designer behind the brand Mossimo.

In the video, the famous daughter takes everyone through a tour of her multiple closets were she keeps a mix of designer and affordable clothing. 

'I’ll link some of my favorite pieces below if you guys want to have matching closets or matching pieces,’ Olivia said in the video as she showed off her exquisite closet. 

She revealed her more expensive pieces, including two Gucci sweaters valued at $1950 a piece. But the star also showed more affordable options for the bargain shopper including a Princess Polly sweater for $50.

The expansive clothing collection is divided into multiple closets including one dedicated to sweaters, another dedicated to light jackets, and another for dresses. 

During the closet reveal, Olive showed off three summer dresses that ranged in price depending on someone's budget. 

'Cause summer is approaching and I want you guys to look cute,' she said as she flaunted vibrant-colored outfits.

The first dress she showed off was a floral print Dolce and Gabbana dress valued at $1,675. She wore the outfit at the designer's event in May to introduce a new fragrance. 

But Olivia also recommended a yellow and black floral dress from Zara that is only $45. 

Below all of her outfits is where Olivia houses her lengthy collection of boots, sneakers, heels and flats. 

Included in her collection is a pair of Gucci loafers valued at $730. But the Youtube star also pointed out a pair of affordable Zara sneakers that people have complimented her on.  

After showing off her clothing in her bedroom, Olivia moved onto her luxury bathroom which included a clawfoot bathtub and large shower. 

Next to her bathroom sink is where Olivia keeps all of her skincare that she uses to maintain her flawless complexion. 

Notable brands include GlamGlow, Glossier, Origins and First Aid Beauty. She has the products organized by what she always reaches for every day, and then a drawer dedicated to masks.

On the other side of her bathroom is where Olivia keeps her expansive makeup collection including an entire bin filled with brushes. There is also a closet behind the area for more clothes and makeup. 

The YouTube star also recently revealed her minimalist bedroom on her channel. 

Featured in the six-minute clip is Olivia's bedroom furniture including her queen-sized bed, two mirrored end tables, an armchair and an area with her Apple desktop so she can edit videos. 

Olivia also pointed out her Louis Vuitton backpack near an armchair in the corner, priced at $2,040, that she bought for herself to use for school. 

Her room also features a $399 flower arrangement from Venus ET Fleur that Marc Jacobs sent after she worked with the company for New York Fashion Week.  

'I was really afraid to do this video because I don't want people to tell me my room is ugly cause I didn't even design it,' Olivia confessed at the end of the video. 

'But I think it's cute.'

Olivia's mom Lori, 53, is a famous actress, while her father Mossimo Giannulli, 54, is the designer behind the brand Mossimo. The YouTube star showed her closet to her followers. Included in the must-have buys were two Gucci sweaters (bottom right), a Dolce and Gabbana dress (top right) and Gucci loafers, together valued at an estimated $6,330. In the video, the famous daughter takes everyone through a tour of her multiple closets were she keeps her mix of designer and affordable clothing.
'I’ll link some of my favorite pieces below if you guys want to have matching closets or matching pieces,’ Olivia said in the video as she showed off her exquisite closet. She showed off her more expensive pieces, including two Gucci sweaters valued at $1950 a piece. But the star also showed more affordable options for the bargain shopper including a Princess Polly sweater for $50.

item.title: In his element! Motoring-mad Duke of Cambridge can barely hide his excitement as he straddles a bike at the Isle of Man TT festival
item.description: Motoring-mad William could barely hide his excitement as he soaked up the atmosphere on Wednesday while watching the powerful motors race past on the famous circuit.
item.content:encoded:
The Duke of Cambridge has joined thousands of racing fans at the Isle of Man TT to watch motorbike riders pit themselves against the world famous circuit.

Motoring-mad William could barely hide his delight as he soaked up the atmosphere on Wednesday while watching the powerful motors race past on the circuit, and even got the chance to sit on a zero-emission Breitling.

The royal once owned a £20,000 Ducati motorbike, which can go from 0-60mph in 2.5 seconds, and was last seen riding the 190mph machine the night before the Royal Wedding in 2011.

His wife Kate, who is currently on maternity leave after welcoming their third child,  once admitted it 'filled her with horror' when he rode his motorbike. 

Scroll down for video 

During a visit to Dundee in 2015, the Duchess of Cambridge told a local: 'He's still riding it. It always fills me with horror when he goes out on it‎. I'm terrified. Hopefully, I'm going to keep George off it.'

However William reportedly said he had put his dangerous hobby on the 'back-burner' while speaking to triple World Superbike champion Jonathan Rea last year.

During his visit today William, clad in a dark navy suit and sunglasses, met with support staff and volunteers before attending a reception for guests from across the island, and visited the Joey Dunlop Foundation.

The Isle of Man Tourist Trophy (TT) Races is an annual Motorcycle race meeting that takes place in June.

It first ran in 1907 and is one of the oldest continuous motorsport events in the world.

William, 35, arrived at the TT Grandstand to watch the final stages of the TT Supersport Race 2 before attending a reception in the Government House Tent.

Guests included representatives from across the Isle of Man, including TT staff and volunteers, civic dignitaries and local businesses.

This year's meeting features nine races including a Superbike Race (for modified 1000cc bikes), the TT Zero for electric bikes, a Lightweight Race (featuring SuperTwin bikes) and two Sidecar Races.

Wednesday’s races will feature the second Supersport TT Race, the TT Zero Race and the Lightweight TT Race.

They are run in a time trial format on closed public roads, with riders competing around the TT Mountain Course circuit which is 37¾ miles long.

William will view a number of races before meeting race officials and support staff and volunteers involved in the running of the event.

The father-of-three will then continue on to the Joey Dunlop Foundation. Established in 2001, the charity creates specialist accommodation for visitors to the Isle of Man with a disability.

Braddan Bridge House, located in Douglas, the island's capital, consists of apartments which accommodate the needs of all guests. 

The charity is named after William Joseph 'Joey' Dunlop, the popular world champion motorcycle racer. 

The royal will meet staff and guests staying in the accommodation and hear how they support guests with disabilities throughout the year.
item.dc:abstract: Motoring-mad William could barely hide his delight as he clambered onto a zero-emission Breitling (left and right) after watching the powerful motors race past on the famous circuit on Wednesday. The prince once owned a £20,000 Ducati motorbike, which can go from 0-60mph in 2.5 seconds, and was last seen riding the 190mph machine the night before the Royal Wedding in 2011. During his visit today he watched the final stages of the Supersport TT Race 2 and met staff and volunteers working at the annual event on the Isle of Man.
item.dc:creator: Unity Blott
item.mi:shortTitle: Prince William joins motorcycle fans at Isle of Mann TT

item.title: Cod almighty! Morrisons shoppers can now tuck into a HUGE 350g fillet of fish with a double portion of chips in its cafes – for just £8.50
item.description: Weighing in at 350g, the jumbo battered haddock is more than double the size of a regular serving of fish and twice the supermarket's usual serving of a 170g fillet (seen right).
item.content:encoded:
Supermarket Morrisons has added a whopping fish and chip dish to its in-store menu.

Weighing in at 350g, the jumbo battered haddock is more than double the size of a regular serving of fish and twice the supermarket's usual serving of a 170g fillet. 

The fish, which is hand-battered to order in Morrisons Market Street Cafe, also comes with a double portion of chips, garden peas, and a wedge of lemon.

The jumbo fish and chips is now available to eat in or takeaway from the stores' cafés until Sunday 24 June.

And it's not just the size that is impressive, hungry customers can tuck into the meal for a budget friendly £8.50 – that's only £3 more than the café's standard portion and 34 per cent cheaper than leading fish and chip retailers.

Helen Tordoff, Head of Cafés at Morrisons, says: 'Our customers love fish and chips but some a-fish-ionados with big appetites wanted a bigger plate of their favourite dish. The meal is also great value for money and hand battered to order.'

It comes just a week after the supermarket   unveiled a supersize 'Big Daddy Breakfast' - which is almost twice the size of their competitors'.

The huge meal is the largest on offer of any supermarket across Britain, with a whopping 19 food items crammed onto one plate.

Breakfast lovers get three rashers of bacon, three pork sausages, three hash browns, two slices of fried bread, two fried eggs and two half tomatoes.

The 'Big Daddy' meal is finished off with two slices of black pudding, baked beans and sliced mushrooms.

The whopping meal, which costs just £6, offers diners seven items more than Asda and Tesco's breakfast.

While Sainsbury's 'Big Breakfast' offers foodies just nine pieces - with just two rashers of bacon and sausages, and only a single egg, hash brown and tomato.

Head of Cafés at Morrisons Helen Tordoff said: 'Our standard cooked breakfast is one of our most popular meals on the menu.

'However, customers have asked for one that's even bigger.

'The 'Big Daddy Breakfast' is an excellent choice for customers with a big appetite.' 

The supermarket has previously been named the best place to head for a cooked breakfast, beating various cafes and hotel establishments.

In 2015 the supermarket was awarded the title of Britain's Best Breakfast for its value for money, food quality and customer satisfaction. 

Morrisons was named best in the breakfast category, beating Wetherspoons and Bella Italia which were shortlisted for the awards. 

Aside from the Big Daddy breakfast the supermarket offers a Big Breakfast, £4.70 and a Little Breakfast £3.90 to those with a smaller appetite.

Customers looking for a healthier option can select from porridge as well as 'super' scrambled eggs.
item.dc:abstract: Weighing in at 350g, the jumbo battered haddock is more than double the size of a regular serving of fish and twice the supermarket's usual serving of a 170g fillet (seen right). The fish, which is hand-battered to order in Morrisons Market Street Cafe, also comes with a double portion of chips, garden peas, and a wedge of lemon. The jumbo fish and chips is now available to eat in or takeaway from the stores' cafés until Sunday 24 June.
