item.title: Is THIS the secret to real happiness? Author reveals how every nice girl should learn to be 'a d***' - and it works for dealing with everything from your mother-in-law to charity collectors
item.description: The Good Girl’s Guide To Being A D***, by Alexandra Reinwarth, already an international bestseller, is the first of her books to be translated into English and is launched in the UK this week.
item.content:encoded:
A writer has revealed how the key to happiness is to stop worrying about being nicer and more patient and embrace your inner d***. 

German-born Alexandra Reinwarth is a bestselling author of over 30 books, now living in Spain. 

The Good Girl’s Guide To Being A D***, already an international bestseller, is the first of her books to be translated into English and is launched in the UK this week. 

She was inspired to write the book after finally telling a difficult friend she didn't want to be around her anymore, and now wants to inspire others to live happier lives by letting go of their constant need to please. 

'In a today’s world, which is getting more and more ruthless, it is more necessary than ever to stand up for your opinion, for your beliefs and to say "No", for you and for others,' she told Femail.  

'There are two groups of people: the ones who think of other people in a way like: how can I help you, what can I offer you that could be useful in your situation?

'The others are more like: how could your existence be useful for me? I’m the first group. And we are nice – too nice.

'We wish to please everyone, want to be liked by our boss and our collegues, by the doctor and also by the grumpy waiter in the pizzeria next door – not mentioning family and friends. 

We are constantly trying not to embarrass ourselves and to be considerate of others.

Don’t get me wrong, that’s a good thing. I think it is great when people are trained from day one not to behave like a*******s – even though, God knows, it doesn’t always work. 

'At the same time, I would appreciate it if we also had the option of finding things, people or situations downright stupid.

The Good Girl’s Guide is about: how not to give a damn about other people or issues; how not to to become a real dick at the same time, and small decisions can have a huge impact on the quality of your life.

PRYING RELATIVES 

How can you stop relatives asking prying questions about your love life and plans to have a baby without offending them and being labelled 'hypersensitive'? 

According to Alexandra, the answer is friendliness.

'With friendliness you don’t have to give a toss about a whole range of issues that cause an inner eye-rolling,' she explained. 'Nobody will be cross with you (in case that still matters), as long as you are friendly:

Auntie Mabel: ‘Have you got a new boyfriend?’. Answer: ‘Ah, Auntie Mabel, let’s not talk about my love life – how was your holiday, that is much more interesting.’

If somebody still carries on prodding, you can always go to the loo. When you return, the clan will have turned to their next favourite topic.'

THE MOTHER-IN-LAW

After years of trying to forge a relationship with her partner's mother by inquiring after her friends and their ailments and frantically tidying the house before she arrived, Alexandra decided to let go. 

She left her mother-in-law to play with her grandson while she got on with sending emails and unloading the dishwasher. 

And when they did sit down to chat, she admitted that she hates cooking, recently got drunk at a party and threw out all the houseplants because she can't keep them alive. 

With friendliness you don’t have to give a toss about all the topics that cause you to inwardly roll your eyes. 

'It’s not bad at all,' she recalled. 'We have a conversation that isn’t totally boring, and I can see clearly now: only when I show myself as I really am and give her the chance to respond, only then can a real conversation develop. Everything else is fake.

We probably won’t turn into besties, but whenever Granny comes visiting now, I am not stressed any more. 

'I don’t have to prepare anything; I can remain relaxed, because I no longer have to play-act.'

UNWANTED ADVICE 

Whether it's your mother's opinion on your parenting methods or your friend's insistence that you should go vegan, advice that makes you want to tear your hair out can be dealt with using an 'agree to disagree' strategy.

Try something like this: ‘Yes, I can see what you mean, but I see that differently and I don’t really want to discuss it now. Let’s just tuck into this gorgeous cake instead. Do you want another piece?’

Remember: With friendliness you don’t have to give a toss about all the topics that cause you to inwardly roll your eyes. Nobody will be cross with you if you publicly disagree about something (in case it is something you do happen to care about) as long as you keep being friendly.

This strategy also has a nice side effect: you are not shying away from saying what you think – and that feels really, really good.

OFFICE COLLECTIONS 

Alexandra made a decision not opt out of the birthday collection which is usually organised by a woman called Michelle for her own gratification, while the person celebrating ends up with a pair of unicorn slippers they don't want.

'The only thing that keeps me from putting this plan into action is what Michelle might think of me when I tell her I don’t want her to count me in any more, and what the others may think when my name is no longer on their birthday cards,' she said. 

'I ponder and ponder, but always come to the same conclusion: really, I really don’t care. Does Sandra from accounts approve of my actions? It simply doesn’t matter.'

AFTER WORK DRINKS  

These days, Alexandra would prefer to go home to her son or enjoy quality time to herself than go for drinks after work but it took her a while to feel confident in saying she won't join the weekly excursion to a nearby gin bar.

She recalled: 'I take a deep breath and simply say it. That I won’t come. Not today and not on any other Friday in the future, because after work I prefer to go home. 

'Also, I don’t particularly like gin. My sentences are still a little clumsy, but after the next person asks it gets better. 

'At the end of the day, when one of the trainees asks me the same question, I have progressed to: "Nope. Not for a million dollars! But have fun!". Life can be so easy.'

CHARITY COLLECTORS/SALESPEOPLE 

'The only thing that still makes you vulnerable is pity,' Alexandra said revealing why you shouldn't feel sorry for charity collectors or anyone trying to sell you something.  

'How about: ‘One question – if I have a little financial crisis in the future, maybe because I have not said no often enough to people like you, could I come to you for help? Could I just visit you and explain my personal situation, and would you be so kind as to help me out? 

'What, you don’t want me to come and see you at home? Oh, so you don’t seem to like it when strangers ring your doorbell and want money from you? Well, well. You sound just like me, then.’

'You don’t even have to say it aloud; it is the thought that will change your attitude. 

'Since it dawned on me that I am not allowed to ring the telephone guy or the electricity people at home and that the man with the double-glazing would be outraged if I turned up on his doorstep, I slam my front door with such force that its hinges quiver.

'And without the slightest trace of a bad conscience. Don’t give a damn about a bad conscience.'

The Good Girl's Guide TO Being a D*ck, by Alexandra Reinwarth is available from Amazon

item.dc:creator: Siofra Brennan

item.title: 'Deadly manure gases possible!' Tourists share the VERY alarming road signs they've spotted around the world (and they might be enough to put you off your next adventure)
item.description: People from around the world have been sharing snaps of the bizarre - and occasionally downright scary - notices on a Reddit thread, and comparing stories of where they had been spotted.
item.content:encoded:
From unexploded bombs to deadly gases, these road signs warn travellers against some rather terrifying potential dangers.

People from around the world shared snaps of the bizarre - and truly scary - notices on a Reddit thread, comparing stories of where they had been spotted. 

One poster was left shocked by a signpost at the entry to a forest which reminded them that they were 'no longer top of the food chain' as they were entering bear country. Another stark warning stated simply: 'Propellers chop off heads'.

Others serve as a grim reminder of the lasting impact of landmines.  

Here, FEMAIL rounds up some of the most startling examples...
item.dc:abstract: People from around the world have been sharing snaps of the bizarre - and occasionally downright scary - notices on a Reddit thread, and comparing stories of where they had been spotted. Pictured clockwise from top left: a warning over landmines; a reminder of the dangers of propellers; the Grim Reaper blocks the entrance to a cave: a notice before entering bear country; an area impacted by 'deadly manure gasses'; an abandoned mine is not a place to explore.

item.title: 'You should name your next child Choking': Mother whose son, 3, choked to death on a bouncy ball reveals the grieving family are being taunted by heartless trolls
item.description: Mother Anna Davis, from Tasmania, whose three-year-old son Alby choked to death on a bouncy ball has revealed how the grieving family are relentlessly taunted by cruel trolls.
item.content:encoded:
The mother of a three-year-old boy who choked to death on a bouncy ball has revealed how the grieving family are relentlessly taunted by cruel trolls.

Anna Davis, from Tasmania, frantically tried to resuscitate her son Alby for 16 minutes until paramedics arrived - but he died just a week before his fourth birthday.

Taking to Instagram, the mother, who's currently 39 weeks pregnant, shared one of the vicious remarks she faces on a daily basis since her toddler's tragic death in March.

The heartless troll sent a private message to the woman, suggesting: 'You should name your next child Choking' before adding a laughing emoji.

She explained the family have been ignoring most of the nasty comments, but this one in particular struck a chord with her.

'I can't even begin to fathom the sadness and hurt this person much have experienced in their lifetime, to feel the desire to intensify our family's heart ache for the sale of their own amusement,' Ms Davis said.

'Trolling comments and DM's are now part of our daily lives, and I can usually dig deep, and find the strength to move on from such hatred, but this one impacted me deeply, and many more tears than usual have fallen today.'

The mother decided to share the cruel message on her Instagram story - but kept the troll anonymous. 

'I've kept you anonymous so as not to give you more of the attention you so obviously crave,' she wrote.

'I wish you nothing but love and happiness from here on out, in the hopes that no other grieving family may experience your bitterness.'

Earlier this year, little Alby tragically died after he choked on the small ball, the size of a slightly larger 50 cent piece, at his family home.
item.dc:abstract: The mother of a three-year-old boy who choked to death on a bouncy ball has revealed how the grieving family are relentlessly taunted by cruel trolls. Anna Davis, from Tasmania, frantically tried to resuscitate her son Alby for 16 minutes until paramedics arrived - but he died just a week before his fourth birthday. Taking to Instagram, the mother, who's currently 39 weeks pregnant, shared one of the vicious remarks she faces on a daily basis since her toddler's tragic death in March.

item.title: The miracle product personal trainer and model Camilla Akerberg, 28, swears by for fat loss, good gut health and stabilised blood sugar - and it costs just $6
item.description: Australian fitness professional Akerberg, 28, attributes much of her svelte physique and glowing complexion to a cult product fast becoming the king of all superfoods.
item.content:encoded:
Certified personal trainer and performance nutrition coach, Camilla Akerberg, is letting fans in on the secret to her killer body - and it's not just her rigorous gym workouts.

The Australian fitness professional attributes much of her svelte physique and glowing complexion to a cult product that is fast becoming the king of all superfoods: apple cider vinegar (ACV).

Starting her day the right way, Camilla, 28, rises early and gets her digestive juices flowing with a large glass of water, squeezed lemon and one tablespoon of ACV. 

Apple cider vinegar has been a multi-purpose health saviour among those in the know for centuries.

Made by steeping chopped apples in water and leaving the concoction at room temperature, naturally occurring sugars in the apples eventually ferment to form the component acetic acid as well as many health-promoting enzymes. 

Nutritionists the world over recommend opting for an unfiltered, organic brand of the product, such as Bragg's apple cider vinegar which is available at Woolworths stores for just $6.

The benefits that go hand-in-hand with regular apple cider vinegar consumption are staggering.

'The positives are quite extensive - if you are not already, you should make it part of your daily routine', Ms Akerberg advises.

This wonder product is especially attractive to diabetics, as Camilla notes that it has been proven to improve insulin sensitivity, stabilise blood sugar levels within a healthy range and and aid the prevention of chronic conditions associated with the ageing process.

Ms Akerberg also explains how drinking just a tablespoon a day of ACV can keep our cardiac and circulatory systems in check. 

Several animal studies have shown a link between ACV, lower cholesterol and optimum blood pressure, which Camilla says could lead to a reduced risk of heart disease.

And for those looking to shed stubborn kilograms, apple cider vinegar could be your new best friend.

'Numerous research studies show that vinegar can increase satiety and therefore help you eat fewer calories which leads to fat loss', Ms Akerberg explains. She suggests taking ACV with carb-heavy meals to help you feel fuller for longer.

Ms Akerberg highlights the benefits which ACV has been demonstrated to have on leaky gut syndrome, an often misdiagnosed condition which is the cause of many serious health problems and widely regarded as a warning sign for many autoimmune diseases.

If all of this still leaves you unconvinced, the far reaching benefits of taking apple cider vinegar even stretch to cancer prevention and treatment. 

Ms Akerberg says that numerous animal studies have confirmed that ACV shrinks cancer cells, and even kill tumors in certain cases.

Common daily uses of the star product also include disinfecting cuts and scars, alleviating warts and soothing painful ear infections.

In addition to incorporating apple cider vinegar into your daily diet plan for a healthier you, Ms Akerberg advocates increasing fibre intake.

She also recommends snacking only on fresh, whole foods or low-calorie, low-GI alternatives and ensuring that you get enough sleep at night to keep those nagging cravings for junk food at bay.

She also suggests taking Vitamin B supplements alongside your ACV drink every morning in order to decrease the desire for sugar.
item.dc:abstract: Certified personal trainer and performance nutrition coach Camilla Akerberg (pictured) is letting fans in on the secret to her killer body - and it's not just her rigorous gym workouts. Australian fitness professional Akerberg, 28, attributes much of her svelte physique and glowing complexion to a cult product that is fast becoming the king of all superfoods. So what is it?

item.title: 'Super villain scar in the making': 27-year-old YouTube star reveals a large wound that runs across her head after having 'extensive brain surgery' to remove a tumor the size of a golf ball
item.description: Swedish inventor and YouTube star Simone Giertz announced in April that she had a non-malignant brain tumor was going to have to undergo extensive surgery.
item.content:encoded:
A YouTube star has proudly shared a photo of her 'super villain scar' on her head after having brain surgery last week.

27-year-old Swedish inventor and YouTube star Simone Giertz announced in April that she had a non-malignant brain tumor was going to have to undergo extensive surgery. She took Twitter on Monday to give her 349,000 followers a post-surgery update. 

'Super villain scar in the making,' she tweeted while sharing a black and white photo of the surgical scar on her head.

Simone's candid post prompted others to take to the comments section of her tweet to share photos of their own surgical scars. 

'WE HAVE MATCHING SCARS NOW! Just means you and I are way more hardcore than anyone else! Happy you are doing better!' fellow YouTuber Charles Trippy wrote, while someone else added. 'Been there. You’re doing great.'

Simone has been candid about her diagnosis, and a few days before her operation she revealed that her mother had arrived in San Francisco to be with her.   

The YouTuber even filmed a video of herself in the hospital right before her surgery on Wednesday.

'I'm at the hospital and I'm about to go into surgery,' she said in the short clip. 'The surgeon offered to take photos of my brain, and I've always been convinced that I have a really beautiful brain, so I am pretty excited about finally getting some proof.'

'I'm feeling fine, but I am pretty scared,' she admitted. 'But that's also the healthy response to the prospect of having your skull cut open.'

Simone went on to explain that the surgery is going to take eight to 12 hours, and she will have someone share an update after it is over. 

'I hope you're having a good day. I hope you're day is more normal than mine,' she said at the end of the video. 

Later that day, a third party shared an update on Simone's Twitter page like she had promised.

Going in to surgery now. See you soon 🧡 pic.twitter.com/I9gDcvU6XY

— Simone Giertz (@SimoneGiertz) May 30, 2018

'Simone is out of surgery and her doctors are very pleased with how everything went. She woke up long enough to make an inappropriate joke... so things are looking good,' the person wrote. 

On Saturday, she returned to Twitter to joke about her post-surgery appearance. 

'I currently look like Smeagol right as he transisitons [sic] to Gollum,' she wrote, and the next day she she joked about her struggle to type.

'Things you probably never have to learn for yourself: steroids really make autocorrect so much more infuriating,' she tweeted. 

Simone first opened up about her diagnosis in a video she posted to her YouTube channel on April 30, explaining that she had a swollen eyelid on her right eye for about a year. 

Although some of her fans had commented on it, she chalked it up to allergies, but she eventually started having pain in her eye and eye socket.

After having an MRI, she found out that she had a 'pretty substantial brain tumor.' 

'Good news is I'm probably not dying,' she said, ' and it seems like the tumor is non-cancerous and benign. But it's pretty big; it's the size of a golf ball. I don't even like golf, but I do like my brain a lot. 

'So I am going to have pretty extensive brain surgery, and I'm probably to be out for awhile.'

She later named the tumor 'Brian' and joked about him getting evicted the week before her surgery. 

'I'm going in to surgery in a week. This is your eviction notice, Brian the Brain Tumor,' she wrote. 'Please remove your property from my skull, eyeball and jaw muscle. I'm also keeping your security deposit.'
item.dc:abstract: Swedish inventor and YouTube star Simone Giertz announced in April that she had a non-malignant brain tumor was going to have to undergo extensive surgery. After having the tumor removed last week, she took Twitter on Monday to give her 349,000 followers an update. 'Super villain scar in the making.' she tweeted while sharing a black and white photo of the surgical scar on her head. Right before her surgery, she shared a video of herself in the hospital. 'I'm feeling fine, but I am pretty scared,' she admitted.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: YouTube star reveals 'super villain scar' after brain tumor surgery

item.title: You wouldn't wear them unless you lost a bet: Designer launches $15 chino trousers with a 'penis pocket' - and they're not exactly flying off the shelves
item.description: Japanese store GU - which is a cheaper offshoot of Uniqlo - have decided to raise the fashion stakes with a pair of trousers that rival those jeans with a clear patch over the knee.
item.content:encoded:
Fashion has given us some fairly strange trends over the years, many of which should probably have never seen the light of day.

Crocs, bumbags, sweater vests and velour tracksuits were once worn by some of the world's most famous people but have all rightly gone their separate ways.

But Japanese store GU - which is a cheaper offshoot of Uniqlo - have decided to raise the fashion stakes with a pair of trousers that rival those jeans with a clear patch over the knee ASOS tried to make 'happen'.

The internet has dubbed them 'penis pocket trousers' because they have a very obvious 'cover' over your manhood.

While the word pocket may make it seem like you could easily fit some spare change in there, don't be fooled.

When you unclip the button on them it merely reveals a zipper, so there isn't a pouch to place extra odds and ends in them.

Aside from the pocket they're just a trendy pair of chinos which come in respectable colourways like tan, navy and white.

And they don't even break the budget at a mere $15 a pop.

Understandably social media was very confused by the trousers themselves and were likening them to the triangular part on a guitar.

People on Twitter joked that the 'pocket seemed on the small size' and others called it the 'condom pocket'.
item.dc:abstract: Japanese store GU - which is a cheaper offshoot of Uniqlo - have decided to raise the fashion stakes with a pair of trousers that rival those jeans with a clear patch over the knee. The internet has dubbed them 'penis pocket trousers' (pictured) because they have a very obvious 'cover' over your manhood. While the word pocket may make it seem like you could easily fit some spare change in there though - don't be fooled. When you unclip the button on them it merely reveals a zipper, so there isn't a pouch to place extra odds and ends in them.
item.dc:creator: Laura House

item.title: Would you pay $100 to be STRETCHED? Pent-up professionals are turning to Australia's first 'flexologist' studio to strain the stress away
item.description: While many take medication or get a massage to cope with pent-up tension, some Australians are now paying professionals to 'stretch' them out.
item.content:encoded:
Office professionals know all too well the discomfort that can come as a result of too much time behind a desk. 

And while many take medication or get a massage to cope with pent-up tension, others are now paying professionals to 'stretch' them out.  

Stretch Studios - the first of its kind in Australia - helps people stretch sore and tired muscles with 'flexologists' - people who have been specially trained in stretching.

Scroll down for video 

And although it may sound like a trendy thing to do, it's something that also came with many benefits, according to co-owner Damian Scarf.

'Stretching your muscles as often as possible is the most effective way to improve your flexibility,' he told FEMAIL.

'It [stretching] can increase blood flow, help you sleep better and aid with digestion.

'It helps the whole body to function better.'

What is flexology? 

* Assisted stretching is a form of static stretching in which a 'flexologist' applies gentle force to the limb to move it into a new position

* Stretches are held for a specific amount of time in order to lengthen and stretch the muscle fibre and tissue 

* This helps to create alignment in the muscle and body and contributes to improved flexibility and increased muscle control

Mr Scarf said those who worked at the assisted stretch studios came from a background in yoga, massage or physiotherapy and were specifically trained in flexology.

'Stretching offers a better range of movement and can activate the deep postural muscles,' Ms Scarf explained.

Despite the fact stretching as a form of fitness was quite new, it's something that's proving incredibly popular.

'People who visit a physio are often given a list of stretches they are supposed to but this is something that never gets done,' said Mr Scarf.

'Now you can visit a stretch studio and pay someone to do these with you.' 

Stretch session times range anywhere from 20 minutes to an hour and roughly cost a $1.00 per minute and an hour session costs $99. 

Mr Scott said up and coming athletes were also turning to professional stretching to help them avoid injury.

'Schools are sending kids in top football and soccer teams to see us prevent injury.'

In fact, he said students from nearby Scots College in Sydney who had been regularly visiting the studio had reduced their injuries by half.

And while many may view stretching with an expert as an unnecessary luxury, it's something that could be as good for you as a regular massage. 

'Every minute of the stretching process is helping your body. It doesn't just feel good, it's doing good.'
item.dc:abstract: Office professionals know all too well the discomfort that can come as a result of too much time behind a desk. And while many take medication or get a massage to cope with pent-up tension, others are now paying professionals to 'stretch' them out. Stretch Studios - the first of its kind in Australia - helps people stretch sore and tired muscles with 'flexologists' - people who have been specially trained in stretching.
item.dc:creator: Laura House
item.mi:shortTitle: Professionals are paying expert 'stretchers' to help them relieve pain

item.title: It's clearly working! Mother-of-three Jennifer Garner, 46, details the exact smoothie she whips up every morning for breakfast to stay in tip top shape
item.description: Jennifer, 46, got into amazing shape when she started working with nutritionist Kelly LeVeque who introduced her to the Be Well breakfast smoothie which Jennifer has every morning now.
item.content:encoded:
Jennifer Garner has revealed the smoothie recipe that she uses for her breakfast every single day, detailing how the healthy beverage helps to keep her in tip top shape. 

The 46-year-old mother-of-three indulges in a refreshing liquid breakfast every morning - the recipe for which features just eight simple ingredients.

Jennifer started to hone in on her fitness when she started working with celeb nutritionist Kelly LeVeque as she prepared for her starring role in the upcoming film Peppermint which is set to release in September 2018. 

After enlisting Kelly as a nutritionist, Jennifer was able to transform her body by following Kelly's most famous health trick - the Fab Four smoothie.

Kelly uses her Fab Four trick in every smoothie she creates as they always contain four major ingredients: enough protein, fat, fiber and greens to keep your body full and energized for hours.

Jennifer posted a video of herself making one type of the Fab Four smoothies - the Be Well smoothie, sharing the recipe writing, 'Don't be scared! It's tastier than it looks!

'I started with Kelly a few months ago to get ready for Peppermint movie and have had her smoothie every day for breakfast since,' Jennifer continued in her caption. 

While the smoothie usually requires fresh blueberries as one of the main ingredients, Jennifer who is the founder of Once Upon a Farm, which sells cold-pressed baby food, applesauce and smoothies, opted to use one of her products instead of the fresh fruit. 

'I decided to play scientist and see if my Once Upon a Farm cold-pressed, organic puree or baby food - if you're a baby, but whatever - could be a substitute for fresh blueberries when I didn't see any in the fridge. Yep, it could,' she wrote.

The recipe for the smoothie is fairly simple and only includes eight ingredients that need to be mixed together in a blender. 

First, add two scoops of Primal Kitchen Chocolate Coconut Collagen Fuel or chocolate protein powder to the blender, then add one tablespoon of ground flax seeds and one tablespoon of chia seeds. 

Once you've added those ingredients, add one tablespoon of almond butter as well as one and a half cups of unsweetened almond milk. 

After that, simply add a handful of fresh spinach, a small handful of ice and a very small handful of blueberries or Once Upon a Farm organic puree, which Jennifer opted for, then just blend it all together and serve. 

Jennifer isn't Kelly's only celebrity client as many are huge fans of her smoothies and many stars including Jessica Alba, Chelsea Handler and Emmy Rossum to name a few, swear by them.

Jessica, 37, drinks a smoothie with omega-3 fatty acids, Vitamin-B for her skin and the Fab Four ingredients of protein, fat, fiber and greens which she loves so much she admitted to Well and Good that she 'always turn to her for advice,' speaking about Kelly. 

Aside from eating clean Jennifer also managed to stay fit by working out to Body by Simone which she posted about just three months ago.

'If you can find a workout that makes you smile, DO IT!!! Watching the sun come up or dancing mid-day, I couldn't do better. Thank you, Simone.

'Thank you for being a bright spot in the last four years, for your inclusive, loving energy, and for making me smile my way through,' Jennifer captioned a video of her working out to the cardio dance class.

Jennifer's new film Peppermint sees the actress transforming into a powerful vengeful character which is why she had to get in tip-top shape and the movie premieres on September 7, 2018.
item.dc:abstract: Jennifer, 46, prepared for her role in upcoming film Peppermint when she started working with nutritionist Kelly LeVeque. Kelly introduced the Be Well breakfast smoothie to Jennifer and she has been drinking it every morning since. The mother-of-three shared a video of herself making the recipe which includes eight simple ingredients. To make the smoothie add chocolate collagen or proteing powder to a blender and add flax seeds, chia seeds, almond butter and milk, spinach and blueberries.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Jennifer Garner drinks the same smoothie every day to stay in shape

item.title: Will self-proclaimed feminist Meghan change the law to allow for a female heir? Duke and Duchess of Sussex's future daughters cannot inherit titles because current legislation only allows dukedoms to pass to men
item.description: Only a male heir can inherit the dukedom - so when Prince Harry died, the title Duke of Sussex will go on to his son, regardless of whether the son is his first-born.
item.content:encoded:
Meghan Markle may not be entirely happy about her new title — or at least, what it means for her future children.

When she and Prince Harry said 'I do' last month, the queen named them the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

But Meghan, 36, a self-described feminist, may have been upset to learn that when it comes to titles, men and women are not treated equally under the law — and if the couple's first-born child is a daughter, she'll have no claim to the same title as her mother.

As People points out, inheritance of titles doesn't work the same way as land or money, and dukedom can only be inherited by male children — not female, regardless of birth order.

So if Harry and Meghan — who are rumored to want to start a family right away — welcome a boy as their first child, he will one day inherit his dad's title, Duke of Sussex. 

But if there first child is a girl, she will simply be called 'Lady'. If the couple has a girl first and then a boy, the second child is heir to the dukedom, and their daughter will be skipped over in that regard.

Meghan has spoken out quite a bit about being a feminist and fighting for women to be treated equally to men, so this bit of news about inequality among her future children may not have gone over well. 

There's also a possibility that she may push to change the rule. Whether she'll be successful is anyone's guess, but it wouldn't be the first time that laws of inheritance have changed to treat women more equally.

The Succession to the Crown Act of 2013 officially changed the policy on who could become king or queen. Before, male children took precedence over female children — so new baby Prince Louis would have been higher in the line of succession than his big sister, Princess Charlotte. 

But now birth order is the determining factor, regardless of sex.

Indeed, Charlotte made history when her younger brother was born in April 2018 as the first female royal to retain her position in the line of succession to the throne, regardless of the gender of her younger sibling.    

'Succession to the Crown not to depend on gender: In determining the succession to the Crown, the gender of a person born after 28 October 2011 does not give that person, or that person’s descendants, precedence over any other person (whenever born),' the act declares.

The same act also meant that members of the Royal family who marry a Catholic will no longer be disqualified. 

Interestingly, the act was viewed by many as an important, and necessary, step for the royal family in terms of embracing a more modern way of life, and is certainly one that was praised by many.  

A number of people have called for a similar change to be made to the legislation regarding peerages, with several high profile supporters speaking out in recent years to demand that women be given the opportunity to carry on their family titles.

Certainly, if Meghan did decide to speak up on behalf of any potential future daughter, she find herself with numerous allies willing to support her stance. 

In 2017, Robin Neville, the 10th Baron Braybrooke, passed away. Baron Braybrooke has no sons and seven daughters — and none of them could inherit his title, or the 6,000-acre Essex estate that went along with it.

Instead, the title and home were passed on to a distant cousin. 

At the time, Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellowes condemned the law, which left the late Barron's eldest daughter Amanda Murray with nothing. 

Amanda chimed in too, pointing out fault with the status quo.

'It boils down to this: If I was a boy, I would be sitting pretty,' she told the Telegraph. 'My poor father had no son; just lots of daughters. 

'In this day and age, with supposed equality, why am I not allowed to inherit my father’s estate?' 

Interestingly, when the Duke of Sussex title was first conferred in 1801, it wasn't passed down either. Prince Augustus Frederick was given the title by his father, King George III — but when he died, it temporarily died out too, since his son was the result of a marriage that was later annulled. 

Prince Harry is only the second-ever Duke of Sussex, while Meghan is the first-ever Duchess of Sussex.
item.dc:abstract: When Meghan Markle and Prince Harry said 'I do' last month, the queen named them the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. But dukedom can only be inherited by male children — not female — regardless of birth order. So if Harry and Meghan — who are rumored to want to start a family right away — welcome a boy as their first child, he will one day inherit his dad's title, Duke of Sussex. But if there first child is a girl, she will simply be called 'Lady'. In 2013, the Succession to the Crown Act changed the law regarding succession to the throne so it is based on birth order, regardless of gender. This means that William and Kate's daughter, Princess Charlotte, follows her older brother George in the line of succession to the throne, however that law applies to those in line for the crown, not members of the peerage.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Prince Harry & Meghan's future daughter won't inherit a title

item.title: Moldovan Playboy model, 28, who is expecting first child with her Egyptian billionaire husband, 65, hints she's having a GIRL as she shares a snap of herself wrapped in a pink ribbon
item.description: Xenia Deli, 28, a Moldovan Playboy model now based in LA, is expecting her first baby with billionaire businessman Ossama Fathi Rabah Al-Sharif. She has hinted to fans that she is expecting a baby girl.
item.content:encoded:
A Modolvan Playboy model who is expecting her first child with an Egyptian billionaire shared an Instagram post hinting she is having a girl.

Xenia Deli, 28, who is now based in LA, is expecting her first baby with businessman Ossama Fathi Rabah Al-Sharif, 65, who is 37 years her senior.

She hinted that they are preparing to welcome a daughter when she shared a snap of herself wrapped in a pink ribbon on Instagram today.   

Posing in a peach bikini with white lace and wearing a wide-brimmed sun hat, she wrote: '4th of June another day to celebrate'. 

The photo was accompanied with an emoji showing a mother and father with a little girl. 

Xenia also posted a video on her Instagram story which appears to show her baby shower, complete with pink balloons, bouquets and two violinists.

The post follows another one from a few weeks ago, where she asked fans to guess the sex of her baby.   

In it, she was posing in a blue bikini which showed her blossoming baby bump, and she wrote: 'Are we having a boy or a girl?'

The Moldovan beauty, who has appeared in pop videos for superstars such as Justin Bieber and Calvin Harris, previously thanked her fans for their support after revealing that she was pregnant.

Fans were divided over the gender of the baby, but many were convinced they knew the answer. 

One wrote: 'Mom told me that if the bump is below, then a girl. If upstairs - a boy. Hence a girl.'

Another commented 'Dear, give us a daughter who is as cute as you are', while one added: 'I think she will be a beauty, the same as you.' 

Xenia revealed she was pregnant earlier this month, after sharing a snap of her bulging belly under a yellow top and holding her stomach with her 850,000 followers.

She married  husband Ossama Fathi Rabah on the popular Greek holiday island of Santorini in June 2016 in a clifftop ceremony costing £860,000.

More than 150 guests attended the outdoor wedding including five bridesmaids, all dressed in blush pink, who took photos with her against the idyllic backdrop.

The newlyweds then enjoyed a few days in the sun on Santorini, before jetting off to Switzerland, where her parents - closer in age to Xenia's husband - live.

'It's the feeling when u wake up and realise that u are the happiest women in the world! And it's only because of you,' she said next to a photos of them holding hands as she wore a huge diamond ring.

'My love, my mentor, my friend!!! Congratulations I love you.'

She wrote next to one of their wedding photos: 'Thank u my love for a memorable day! Engraved in my heart forever!'

They began dating in late 2015, making their courtship a whirlwind with their wedding barely six months later.  

Mr Rabah won her over by buying expensive gifts including diamonds, a red Maserati, huge bouquets of flowers, and trips in his private jet.

Deli never tried to hide the age difference between them and on a number of occasions has personally responded to critics online.

'Who you are to judge the life I live? I'm not perfect and I don't have to be! Before you start pointing fingers, make sure your hands are clean,' she said to one.

The former teaching student appeared on the cover of Playboy and in FHM, GQ, Sports Illustrated, Vogue, Harper's Bazaar, and Maxim. 

Mr Rabah is Muslim of Palestinian origin but Deli maintained her Eastern Orthodox faith after the marriage. 

Her model career began when she married photographer Patrick Cox who she met while working as a waitress and went to modelling school.

The pair divorced years ago but it was not clear when nor why their relationship soured. She also dated singer Egor Kreed in 2015 before meeting Mr Rabah.

Fans speculated she was dating Bieber after their suggestive music video for smash hit What Do You Mean? came out in 2015 but the pair were never linked.
item.dc:abstract: Modolvan Playboy model Xenia Deli, 28, who is now based in LA, is expecting her first baby with businessman Ossama Fathi Rabah Al-Sharif, 65, who is 37 years her senior (pictured right together). She hinted that they are preparing to welcome a daughter when she shared a snap of herself wrapped in a pink ribbon on Instagram today (left). The mother-to-be also posted a video on her Instagram story (inset) which appears to show her baby shower, complete with pink balloons, bouquets and two violinists.

item.title: H&M reveals it's making its sizes BIGGER in UK stores following complaints from customers who struggled to fit into its clothes
item.description: H&M is making its UK sizes bigger in response to customer criticism. The store has been slammed by shoppers on social media, who say its sizes are often smaller than that of other high street chains.
item.content:encoded:
H&M has revealed it is making its UK sizes bigger following years of complaints from customers who have struggled to fit into its clothes.

The retail giant has faced widespread criticism from shoppers who claimed its sizing was smaller than that of other high street chains.

Now, the high street fashion goliath has announced it is updating its sizing to bring it in line with standard UK measurements.

The changes have started with store stock and will be extended to include online offerings. 

Scroll down for video 

An H&M spokesperson told HuffPost UK: 'Following customer feedback, we are taking the steps to change our womenswear measurements to be in line with UK sizing, for example the previous measurements and fit of a size 12 will now be the measurements of a size 10.'

It was revealed last week that the reason why shoppers often find themselves unable to squeeze into their regular dress size at H&M is because of the way it corresponds to its European size.  

Every UK dress size has a corresponding European size with the smallest - a size 4 - being the equivalent to an EUR 32. 

A UK 12 is an EUR 40, according to size conversion charts but at H&M it's labelled a 38, meaning it's actually a size 10.

This doesn't just apply to a size 12 though. Images of H&M clothing has revealed that the UK size does not match up to its corresponding European size and is in fact one smaller.

Last week, on the brand's Facebook page, size 12 Lowri Byrne, a 22-year-old student from Swansea, shared photos of herself donning a size 16 dress and described the fit as 'absolutely ridiculous' and noted that she could 'barely breathe'.

Meanwhile Marianne Gray, 29, from Glasgow, who usually wears a UK size 12, was shocked to discover she only fitted a size 20 in store.

And in August 2017, Samantha Bell, from Manchester, took to Facebook to call out H&M for its 'crazy' sizing. 

Bell discovered that their size 16 jeans were significantly smaller than jeans in the same size from Primark and saw her photo showing the difference go viral on social media. 

Today, customers praised the news that H&M was altering its sizes.

Reacting to the announcement, Stephanie Lauren told MailOnline: 'That's great news. The amount of times I've felt fat because I can't fit into my usual size of a 10 is ridiculous.

'They were so tiny before, I ended up buying a size 14 once from there because the dress just wouldn't zip up. It's as though they were all made for petite women, or incredibly skinny women with no bumps and curves. 

'And their shoes are just as bad, I hope they change them too.' 

Beth, 24 from North Wales, said: 'It projects totally the wrong messages about body image. I don't shop there because I refuse to buy something a size bigger than what I actually am. 

'It has a negative effect. It makes shopping really confusing and you can't go in and grab something like you would elsewhere. 

'I'm surprised its taken them this long and makes me wonder what is the actual point of doing it? Surely make them bigger at a smaller size if you want to do it wrong.'

The clothing retailer has already started sending out new labels to bring their sizes in line.

However, H&M has also asked for patience, saying that it will take time to bring all their stock up-to-date. 

The spokesperson said: 'This will be a gradual process and we cannot confirm when this will be 100 per cent complete.

'The new sizing is in effect already in our stores and shortly will be online, we aim to make this transition as smooth as possible for the customer.' 

UK TO EUR SIZE CONVERSION 

UK size 

4

6

8

10

12

16

18

item.title: Moving on! Meghan Markle's chef ex is 'expecting his first child' with his singer girlfriend - days after her ex-husband revealed he is engaged again
item.description: Meghan dated chef Cory Vitiello (main) after her split with ex-husband Trevor Engelson. Cory is reportedly expecting a child with his girlfriend, Martina Sorbara (inset).
item.content:encoded:
Meghan Markle's ex-boyfriend of nearly two years is said to be expecting his first child, just weeks after the actress tied the knot with Prince Harry.

According to US Weekly, celebrity chef Cory Vitiello, who began dating Meghan in 2013 after her split from her first husband, and his girlfriend, singer Martina Sorbara, 39, are expecting a baby together. 

Cory and Meghan dated until about three months before she met Prince Harry - whom she married in a beautiful ceremony on May 19, just weeks before news about her ex's impending arrival was revealed.

This news comes just two days after it was revealed that Meghan's ex-husband Trevor Engelson asked for his girlfriend, dietitian Tracey Kurland, to marry him. 

The 41-year-old film producer and talent agent shared the news on his private Instagram account Friday with a picture with his smiling bride.

He captioned the photo: 'Luckiest guy I know! Get ready to party!' 

This will be Trevor's second marriage after he wed Meghan in at the Jamaica Inn in Ocho Rios, Jamaica, in September 2011. The pair remained together for two years before quietly separating in August 2013. 

Meghan then started dating Cory shortly after her split with Trevor.  

She was with the laid-back restaurateur – who bears a striking resemblance to Harry – for almost two years before he began to tire of her alleged 'prima donna-like behavior', a well-placed source told the Daily Mail.

When they went out for the evening or traveled together, she would embarrass Cory, 38, by announcing she starred in the US television series Suits, and asking for the best tables and seats.

The final straw came at a dinner party for friends, it is rumored. When their guests praised the inventive main course of pasta interwoven with courgette spirals, Meghan claimed she had dreamed up the recipe when, in truth, Cory had created the dish.

Soon after this alleged episode their love-match, which some observers had believed would lead to the altar, was over.

The inside story of their relationship, which began in 2014, the year after her divorce from film producer Trevor Engelson, and ended in spring 2016, has never been told – until now.

Cory was one of Canada's most eligible bachelors, appearing on TV and dating some of the nation's most high-profile women.

He and Meghan met when she dined with Suits cast members at The Harbord Room, the trendy Toronto restaurant he then owned.

They quickly fell in love, and according to his mother Joanne he began staying at Meghan's rented townhouse near the restaurant. The chef's mother describes them as 'homebodies' who avoided attending public events if possible and did their best to keep the romance private.

At Christmas 2015 Mrs Vitiello and her husband Gerry, a retired teacher, invited Meghan to spend Christmas at their detached home in Brantford, two hours' drive from Toronto. 'She had no airs or graces when she was with us,' Mrs Vitiello said.

'She was very interested in being with the people she was with. She had a good sense of humour, and she's very personable. We certainly enjoyed the conversations we had with her. It was all lovely when we were with Meghan.'

Mrs Vitiello would not comment on whether she had expected to hear wedding bells, but said: 'It was serious. They were living together in the house, and they were in their 30s, so they weren't young kids.'

She said her son has never told her why they broke up, and she doesn't see it as her place to ask.

Mrs Vitiello and Meghan remained in touch by text and email, and Meghan sent a message telling her she was dating someone else before the world learned she was romancing Harry.

Meghan didn't reveal who that 'someone' was, but shortly before her relationship with Harry became public she asked permission to visit the chef's parents. They were away so the meeting didn't take place, but Mrs Vitiello has no doubt that Meghan had intended to tell them about Harry 'out of respect'.

And as for the claim about the pasta recipe? 'I have never heard that story,' said Mrs Vitiello with a laugh.

Cory told the Mail before the royal wedding simply that Meghan was a 'great girl' and he was 'proud of her'.
item.dc:abstract: Meghan dated chef Cory Vitiello (right) after her split with ex-husband Trevor Engelson and before she met Prince Harry. Cory is reportedly expecting a child with his girlfriend, Martina Sorbara. US Weekly reports the 38-year-old chef is expecting a child with Martina Sorbara (left), 39, who is a singer for the Canadian electro band Dragonette. This news comes just two days after it was revealed that Meghan's ex-husband Trevor Engelson asked for his girlfriend, dietitian Tracey Kurland, to marry him. Meghan was with Cory for almost two years but the laid-back restaurateur – who bears a striking resemblance to Harry – began to tire of her alleged 'prima donna-like behavior', a well-placed source told the Daily Mail. Pictured inset is Meghan and Cory together before their split in 2016.

item.title: A growing brood! Eric and Lara Trump reveal they want 'at least two kids' in a candid interview at their lavish home in Westchester - as he slams the public scrutiny of his younger siblings Tiffany and Barron
item.description: Eric, 34, and Lara, 35, opened up about their family and raising their eight-month-old son, Luke, in their Hudson Valley home while posing for a spread featured in Westchester Magazine.
item.content:encoded:
Eric and Lara Trump are looking to have more children in the future, but how many more is still up to debate.

The couple opened up about their family and raising their eight-month-old son, Luke, in their Hudson Valley home while posing for a spread featured in Westchester Magazine.

During their joint interview, Eric, 34, joked that he may need the digital recording as a reminder to Lara, 35, that she is open to having more than two children.

'She was always set on just one more. But you heard her; you’ve got the comments on tape — she said "at least two kids!"' he said, prompting Lara to reply: 'I'm not making any promises.'

The couple welcomed their son in September 2017, and the proud parents often share photos and videos of their first child on their social media pages.

'Eric is a great dad,' Lara said, 'and I always knew he would be because — I know it may sound crazy — but I saw how he was with our dogs and how much he cared about them.'

Although the animal love was admittedly content with turning their 'house into a zoo,' Eric said Lara 'fell in love with Luke immediately.'

Eric and Lara split their time between their homes in New York City and Westchester County, and they both can seem themselves raising Luke in Briarcliff Manor.

'I love the idea of raising our son, or hopefully our children, in a place like Westchester. Great people, great schools, so many activities,' Lara said.

Although Weschester has become a bit of a sanctuary to them, they are no longer able to fly under the radar like they once did before Eric's father, Donald Trump, became the 45th President of the United States. 

'Every day, you get abused by somebody,' Eric said of the media coverage in this divisive political climate, 'and the next thing you know, you’re being parodied on Saturday Night Live.'

Eric said he expects and accepts that he and his older siblings Donald Jr. and Ivanka face criticism for aligning themselves with their father, but he doesn't think his 24-year-old sister Tiffany and 12-year-old brother Barron should face the same scrutiny.  

'We are adults; we’ve developed a bit of an armor,' he said, 'but Barron and Tiffany should be 100 per cent off-limits.' 

Despite the constant attention and scrutiny, Eric said that Westchester residents have been supportive of his family overall. So much so, that he and his wife are often asked to take selfies with the locals. 

Growing up, Eric spent a large portion of his childhood at Seven Springs, the lavish Westchester mansion that his father purchased in 1995.   

'Westchester had a major impact on my life,' he said. 'I went to school in the city, but I was in Westchester on the weekends and over the summers. It was my place to go to get away from everything.'

Although Eric went to school in New York City, he spent his weekends and summers at their Westchester home — where he and his brother Donald Jr. were often put to work restoring and maintaining the 230-acre property. 

The real estate mogul said the physical labor taught him the 'building blocks' of what he does now, noting that the work also kept them 'away from the-less-than healthy nonsense' that their friends got into.  

While home repairs come naturally to Eric, he admitted that his wife once suggested he call an electrician when she came home and found him doing electrical work in their closet out of fear that he was going to hurt himself. 

However, Eric simply reminded her that he is a 'builder' and this is what he does.   

'Eric can fix anything,' Lara said. 'He’s much handier than anyone I’ve ever dated.'

The area means so much to Eric that he actually proposed to Lara at Seven Springs during a hike, after five years of dating. 

Lara, who grew up in North Carolina, was new to New York when they first started dating, and she wasn't initially keen on spending her time in Westchester. However, she quickly fell in love with the area when she realized how much it meant to him. 

The mother-of-one is an accomplished equestrian, and one of her favorite things to do in the area is ride horses at a barn in Northern Westchester. She actually broke two of her wrists horseback riding and needed surgery just weeks before her 2014 wedding to Eric. 

However, despite her injuries, their wedding was held at the Trump family's Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach, Florida, without a hitch. 

Lara simply concealed her casts with a pair of satin covers that resembled evening gloves, and Eric said he doesn't thing 'anyone could really tell that she was injured.'   

'You couldn’t have told me that day that I had broken wrists,' his wife added. 'We had the best wedding ever.'

Lara is both outdoorsy and athletic, and in addition to horseback riding, she also runs, works out with a trainer, and competes in triathlons. In March, she finished fifth in the age group in the Las Olas Triathlon in Florida. 

She completed the race in two hours and sixteen minutes — six months after she gave birth. When she finished the same triathlon the year before, she was pregnant with Luke.

'She is nutty,' Eric said affectionately, noting that he is actually the one in their immediate family that hasn't completed a triathlon.  

Although they spend a great deal of time in New York City and Mar-a-Lago, Lara said their home in Westchester is their 'favorite place to be.'   

'Our friends make fun of us because we love simply spending time at our house by ourselves,' she admitted. 'They are always asking us to join them on trips here and there, and we just say we’re going to stay home. We love it.'  

Photos from the shoot show Eric and Lara cuddled on the couch with their son and their two dogs in their Westchester home, which Lara describes as 'comfortable.' 

Eric has on a gray suit, while Lara is donning a cream lace blazer and jeans. Little Luke looks just as stylish in a Burberry shirt and white jeans. 

The couple was also photographed strolling the grounds of  Trump National Golf Club in Briarcliff Manor.

Lara is wearing a figure-hugging off-the-shoulder magenta dress, and Eric is looking lovingly into her eyes as they walk past an ornate fountain on the property.  

Eric took to Twitter lats Wednesday to share a photo of the spread and thank the magazine for the glowing profile.

'Thank you @WestchesterMag for the wonderful profile!' he wrote. '@LaraLeaTrump and I (and Luke, Charlie and Ben) really enjoyed spending time with you at @TrumpNationalNY.'
item.dc:abstract: Eric, 34, and Lara, 35, opened up about their family and raising their eight-month-old son, Luke, in their Hudson Valley home while posing for a spread featured in Westchester Magazine. The couple was photographed with their baby boy and their two dogs inside their Briarcliff Manor home, as well as walking the grounds at Trump National Golf in Westchester. During their joint interview, they revealed they are planning on having more children and Eric weighed in on the scrutiny that surrounds his siblings now that his father is president.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Eric and Lara Trump pose for Westchester Magazine spread

item.title: 'What's up with her inner thighs?' Kendall Jenner comes under attack online as people accuse her of editing her legs to make them look thinner - while others mock her TAN LINES
item.description: Instagram fans are accusing Kendall Jenner of using Photoshop to make her thighs look thinner and longer after Kourtney Kardashian posted a picture of her wearing a bikini.
item.content:encoded:
As one of the world's most in-demand supermodels, Kendall Jenner is no stranger to baring her body for all the world to see.   

And over Memorial Day weekend, the 22-year-old showed off her flawless figure in a two-piece navy and red high-waist bikini while holding a water gun, as she posed alongside older sister Kourtney Kardashian, 39, Jordyn Woods, 20, and DJ Simi Khadra, 25. 

However, observant fans immediately took to the comments section of the snap posted to Instagram by Kourtney, to accuse Kendall of digitally altering her image, specifically her legs. 

While the five foot, 10 inches beauty has naturally longer legs than most, several people have suggested that Kendall used Photoshop to make them look even longer and thinner than they really are. 

Instagram user @bohemian.rhapsody33 wrote: 'What's up with Kendall's inner thighs'. 

A sentiment shared by @lilblublack who quipped: 'Ewe Kendal’s body is gross as f*ck lol'. 

And @ashleigh.thornton who asked: 'what’s up with @kendalljenner long ass legs'.   

While @karmenmedina_ said: 'Photoshop on point lol if you're gonna do it at least do it properly'. 

And @nicksuff added: 'u should really hire a new photoshop guy. You don't even have to magnify this one to spot the edits'. 

Others focused in on Kendall's tan lines, including @babygirl_f.a who typed: 'What the hell is up with Kendall Jenner's #babypowdercrotch??'  

This isn't the first time observant fans have accused the 22-year-old of using Photoshop to alter her image.  

On May 22, hundreds of people took to the comments section of her Instagram page to suggest the California native had used a digital editing tool to make her torso appear thinner.   

Posing topless in a hotel bathroom in a pair of Calvin Klein panties, Kendall's naked breasts were covered by her forearm as she sipped a glass of red wine.

Kendall captioned the photo which was taken by Hailey Baldwin, 'bone-dry'.

She then snapped a picture of Hailey as she savored a glass or red wine in a bubble bath.

However, people in the comments section weren't focusing on her nudity and highlighted a curve in the wall to the left of her stomach, a tell-tale sign that a digital editing tool has been used.

Instagram user @_mahtabrezaeii_ shared: 'photoshop belly failed'.

While @alejolopezsedano wrote: '@kendalljenner or your walls are bending or you have a very basic photoshop level'.

A sentiment shared by @collectionn123 who typed: 'Nice photoshop'. 

And @mcc.official.ac added: 'Love the photo but I feel like you have a little photoshop fail right here'.

Similar to @mcclareahh who pleaded: 'Photoshop! Seriously people look at her elbow'.

Not one to shy away from body-baring shots, Kendall is a fan of posting pictures of her gym-honed curves on her Instagram page.

However, in October 2017 she was also accused of Photoshopping a close-up of her butt.

In the picture which saw the model wear a red swimsuit, the walls in the background appeared to be off balance with one side higher up than the other. 

Sisters Kim Kardashian West and Kylie Jenner have also been accused of Photoshopping their images in the past.
item.dc:abstract: Instagram fans are accusing Kendall Jenner of using Photoshop to make her thighs look thinner and longer after Kourtney Kardashian posted a picture of her wearing a bikini. In the shot, the 22-year-old can be seen posing poolside with sister Kourtney, 39, Jordyn Woods, 20, and Simi Khadra, 25 over Memorial Day weekend. This comes after Kendall was accused of using a digital editing took to make her torso look thinner after she posted a shot of her posing topless in a hotel bathroom on May 22.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: People are accusing Kendall Jenner of Photoshopping her legs

item.title: Mystery solved! The Backstreet Boys FINALLY explain the confusing lyrics in their 1999 hit I Want It That Way - after a baffled Chrissy Teigen voiced her confusion over the song on Twitter
item.description: The single was released in 1999, and its lyrics have continued to baffle fans. Chrissy Teigen complained about the non-sensical chorus on Twitter, and the band's official Twitter account replied.
item.content:encoded:
For nearly two decades, the Backstreet Boys' hit song I Want It That Way has inspired millions of listeners to sing along — even though most would admit they have no idea what the words they're singing actually mean.

The lyrics to the 1999 single are certainly confusing: What, exactly, is the 'that way' that the boys are referring to? 

But while the boyband has spent nearly 20 years refusing to clear things up, this week they finally offered up an explanation for the words to the song after being prompted by a tweet from Chrissy Teigen

Chrissy complained about the lyrics in a tweet on June 1, which has gone on to earn 56,000 likes.

'"I never wanna hear you say, 'I want it that way' cause i want it that way". He doesn’t wanna hear it because he is the one that wants it that way? He wants to be the one to say it? Also what is “it”?' she wrote.

'It seems they both want it the same way but are fighting over who gets to say they want it that way,' she added.

Hours later, the official Twitter account for the Backstreet Boys responded, offering a breakdown of the lyrics.

'Don’t wanna hear you say that you want heartaches and mistakes... or to be 2 worlds apart,' the account tweeted. 'We don’t want you to want "it" that way - that’s the way we want it... for you to not want it that way.' 

Fans were amazed that Chrissy managed to get a response, when the band had avoided explaining the lyrics for so long.

I Want It That Way chorus lyrics

Tell me why

Ain't nothin' but a heartache

Tell me why

Ain't nothin' but a mistake

Tell me why

I never want to hear you say

I want it that way

'Dear Chrissy, fans and media have been asking for years but YOU...you have gotten it out of them. You should win a Nobel Peace Prize for this (or something like that),' wrote one.

'What kind of voodoo magic does she have that she got the answer?!' wrote another.

While BSB did finally clear up the confusion with the explanation, though, the reasoning they gave may not actually have been the original intent of the lyrics.

In fact, the men have admitted in the past that the words don't actually make any sense. In a 2016 interview with the Huffington Post, several of the band members acknowledged that there was some internal dialogue about the lyrics before the song was released.

Written by hit-maker Max Martin, the song was very catchy — even if the words, strictly speaking, were gibberish.


'Well it’s funny, we actually were OK with the lyrics when we heard it first,' Nick Carter said. 

But the president of JIVE Records, which was releasing their album, noticed that the words didn't add up, and had some A&R people change the lyrics. 

'To make the song make more sense,' Kevin Richardson said.

Producers were hired to redo the song, and BSB even recorded a version with different words 

The Backstreet Boys were releasing the album with JIVE and so the label having a problem with the nonsense lyrics could have derailed the single.

According to LA Weekly, part of the new song went: 'No goodbyes (ain't nothing but a heartache) / No more lies (ain't nothing but a mistake) / That is why / I love it when I hear you say, / "I want it that way."'

However, when BSB heard the new version, they decided it didn't have the same ring as the original, messed-up lyrics and all.

'So, there was another version of the song out there and then we listened to it back. Then, we as a group voted on it and said, "No,"' Carter said.

So how did the nonsensical lyrics make it to recording in the first place? Max Martin was responsible for a long list of hits — including Britney Spear's Hit Me Baby One More Time (which also has some strange lyrics).

But Martin, who is Swedish, didn't have a great grasp on English — hence lyrics that didn't make sense.

Martin also wrote NSYNC's Tearin' Up My Heart, Robyn's Show Me Love, Kelly Clarkson's Since U Been Gone, Katy Perry's Hot 'N Cold, and Taylor Swift's I Knew You Were Trouble.
item.dc:abstract: The hit single was released in 1999, and its lyrics have continued to baffle fans. Chrissy Teigen complained about the nonsensical chorus on Twitter, and the band's official Twitter account replied. They explained that they 'never want to hear you say' that you want heartaches and mistakes. The explanation may have just been made up, as several of the band members admitted in the past that the lyrics are gibberish. They were written by Swedish songwriter and producer Max Martin, whose English wasn't good at the time of writing it in the late 90s.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: The Backstreet Boys FINALLY explain the lyrics in I Want It That Way

item.title: 'The perfect child will find you': Sandra Bullock, 53, breaks down as she details the moment she met her adopted son Louis, as she admits she thought she had missed her chance at motherhood
item.description: Actress Sandra Bullock, 53, teared up as she discussed motherhood and how her children are now her number one priority with Today show host Hoda Kotb.
item.content:encoded:
Sandra Bullock couldn't help but be overcome with emotion as she discussed adopting her two children in a new Today interview during which she candidly revealed that she thought she had missed her chance to become a mother.

The actress sat down with fellow adoptive mom Hoda Kotb for an emotional one-to-one conversation, during which the women, both 53, discussed their kids, and how they cope with juggling family life and their careers.

Having experienced phenomenal success on the screen, Oscar winner Sandra, who is mother to an eight-year-old son, Louis, and six-year-old daughter, Laila, shared that as a parent, her children are now her number one priority.

Scroll down for video  

'Everything is about them being okay, being in school, having what they need, their moments. I need to be there for every single moment they have. It's harder for me to leave them than I think it is for them when I leave. I don't leave that much and I don't work that much anymore either,' Sandra shared. 

'I keep looking at them going, "I got nothing but you," and they're like [noise]. You know, I told them where they can go to college. I said, "These are the places that I feel comfortable living. So you have these choices." 

'So my priorities are my kids, my kids, my kids. My family. My family. That's it.'

However, being a parents wasn't always part of the plan and the actress who is currently promoting her latest movie Oceans 8 detailed that as she entered her forties she started to accept that children might not be part of the plan. 

However, when Hurricane Katrina hit in 2005, all that changed. 

'Katrina happened in New Orleans. And I knew. Like, just something told me that my child was there. It was weird,' Sandra explained as she fought back tears.  

'Was it a gut feeling or a God feeling?' Hoda asked to which the actress replied: 'I think they're one and the same. I don't think there's a difference. I really don't. 

'And-- and it was the process of filling out forms, filling out forms, being judged, being-- you know, having-- sort of being in the spotlight, you know, about who you are as a human being that is awkward.'

The process of adoption was a long and drawn out one, and Sandra revealed that she had to wait several years to meet her son Louis before finalizing the move in 2010 as she divorced her cheating ex-husband Jessie James. 

However the maternal bond was instant, and she also purchased a home in the city's affluent Garden District so her son could grow up in his hometown. 

'It's like he had always been there. It's like he fit in the crook of my arm. He looked me in the eyes and he was just, he was wise. My child was wise.' 

Something Hoda, who has adopted a daughter of her own named Haley Joy, could empathize with first hand. 

'Funny what you know in, like, a second,' the TV host offered before telling Sandra that her adoption journey gave her the confidence to start looking into adoption herself.    

Sandra added: 'I hope me telling my story let people know that there's no end game.'

'There are hundreds of thousands of children that are ready to be your child. You're a forever parent the minute you accept the love of that child,' Sandra said, tearing up and pausing to speak as her voice caught in her throat.

'And it's amazing to me how we can take away people's happiness by telling them this is the box you have to stay in. There is no box.'

And she also revealed that it was her son Louis who prompted her to adopt her daughter after he told Sandra and a group of her friends that he was going to have a new baby soon. 

In late 2015, she adopted a girl named Laila, who was three-and-a-half at the time.

'Louis has a very strong way, and he's a fine leader, and he lead me to Lai,' she added.     

And she also told Hoda, who admitted she had 'chills' listening to the mother-of-two speak so passionately about her offspring, that she believes becoming a mother was her destiny - 'not being an actress'. 

'This is my purpose. And I knew it at a very young age.'  

Watch @hodakotb’s full exclusive interview about adoption, #Oceans8 and more with Sandra Bullock pic.twitter.com/wE5pciD9uC

— TODAY (@TODAYshow) June 4, 2018

The doting mom mostly keeps Louis, now eight, and Laila, six, out of the public eye, which hasn't been easy. She told InStyle recently, 'I had to figure out how to hide the kids’ faces because there was a bounty on our heads. 

'When you adopt a child, there’s a placement period, and if something goes sideways, they have the right to take the child away. It’s a tenuous, strenuous six months. 

'We had an allergy scare that sent us to the ER, and we were followed by the paparazzi, so the word was out that I had another child. And everyone wanted photos. It was heartbreaking,' she went on. 

'Louis would hear a helicopter or drone, and he’d run to get his sister and drag her across the lawn and hide her under the trampoline. So poor Laila had PTSD. But it took the bounty off once we did those official photos.'

She has also been speaking lately about characterizing adopted children as such. When speaking about how many children are in foster care and looking for homes, she got emotional once again.

'Look: I’m all for Republican, Democrat, whatever, but don’t talk to me about what I can or can’t do with my body until you’ve taken care of every child who doesn’t have a home or is neglected or abused,' she said.

'It makes me teary-eyed. Let’s all just refer to these kids as "our kids." Don’t say "my adopted child." No one calls their kid their "IVF child" or their "oh, s***, I went to a bar and got knocked-up child." Let just say, "our children."
item.dc:abstract: Actress Sandra Bullock, 53, teared up as she discussed motherhood and how her children are now her number one priority with Today show host Hoda Kotb. During the interview, Sandra got her choked up as she discussed loving her kids, eight-year-old Louis and six-year-old Laila, who she adopted in 2010 and 2015. During the intimate one-to-one conversation, the two adoptive mothers, also emotionally discussed their kids and juggling family life with their careers.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Sandra Bullock tears up as she discusses motherhood with Hoda Kotb

item.title: Her Majesty’s new right hand woman! Newlywed Meghan will accompany the Queen on a whirlwind day of engagements in Chester next week – in her first royal outing WITHOUT Harry
item.description: The new Duchess of Sussex, 36, will be joining the 92-year-old monarch to open the Storyhouse Theatre and attend a lunch in Chester next Thursday. They will also open the Mersey Gateway Bridge.
item.content:encoded:
Meghan will be looking to get tips from the Queen as she prepares to conduct her first joint engagement with Her Majesty in Chester.

The new Duchess of Sussex, 36, will be joining the 92-year-old monarch to open the Storyhouse Theatre and attend a lunch in the city next Thursday.

The pair will also open the Mersey Gateway Bridge in Widnes, Cheshire, on the same day. 

This is expected to be Meghan's first official engagement without Harry, and among her first appearances following their honeymoon.

Harry and Meghan have not been seen in public since Prince Charles' 70th birthday celebrations at Buckingham Palace last month, just three days after their wedding.  

However, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex are expected to appear on the Buckingham Palace balcony with the rest of the royal family during the Trooping the Colour parade this Saturday.

The pair are believed to have jetted off on their honeymoon last week, with reports that they have chosen Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge in Canada as their destination. 

According to TMZ, the new Duke and Duchess are staying at the 6,000 sq ft Outlook Cabin which has been dubbed 'The Royal Retreat'. 

Previous royal visitors include King George VI and the Queen Mother, who stayed there in 1939, and Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip, who visited in June 2005. 

Other famous names who have visited the spot include Anthony Hopkins, John Travolta and Bill Gates. 

It had previously been reported that Harry and Meghan wanted to 'hit the ground running' when it came to their royal duties following the wedding.

Aides are promising that the second half of this year will be ‘incredibly busy’ for Harry and Meghan when it comes to official visits.  

The pair are already scheduled to visit Sydney in October for the Invictus Games. 

The couple are expected to then continue their tour Down Under to include visits to New Zealand, Fiji and Tonga. 

The newlyweds are also expected to undertake a couple of short overseas visits before the start of the summer, including a two-day visit to Dublin.  

However, it appears that Meghan will be learning the ropes from the Queen ahead of overseas visits later in the year.  

While the Duchess of Cambridge joined the Queen on several engagements in 2012 after marrying William, her first official engagements as a member of the royal family were not with the monarch.
item.dc:abstract: The new Duchess of Sussex, 36, will be joining the 92-year-old monarch to open the Storyhouse Theatre and attend a lunch in Chester next Thursday. The pair will also open the Mersey Gateway Bridge in Widnes, Cheshire, on the same day.
